Claudia, 31, currently lives with her husband and is the mother of a newborn baby.  She lives in a modest house that she owns.  She's a very enterprising and innovative woman who's always known for realizing her goals and objectives.

She has lived in her home for three years and very much wants to be able to improve it because she wants to buy the rights to potable water and electricity.  She also wants to improve her house somewhat so she and her family have no limitations.

Currently Claudia sells tortillas and fruit.  She's a woman who strives and always sells what she plans to in a day.  The only thing she wants is to receive the previously mentioned benefits, so she's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy bricks, sand, potable water service, and electric wiring.

She wants with all her heart for her dream to come true so she can live in peace and have no limitations for living her life happily in her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, potable water service, and electric wiring

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: María Consuelo de 29 años de edad, habita junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos (de 12, 9 y 1 año de edad), es una mujer muy entregada al trabajo que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, luchadora con los que haceres del hogar. Es una mujer con virtudes ya que a pesar de sus limitantes siempre ha salido adelante, ella se dedica a elaborar Comales de barro para comercializar y además cultiva granos básicos, cada mañana se levanta con deseos de superación es por eso que en esta ocasión a solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para mejorar su vivienda ya que es lo que a ella en este momento le interesa. Además para la salud de sus 3 hijos desea tener la conexión para el agua potable, comprar tubos para finalizar la red de tubería, laminas y madera para ampliar una habitación. Desea que su crédito se lleve a cabo ya que no dejara de luchar para que se le cumpla.
texts.en: María Consuelo is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children (aged 12 and 9 and 1 years old). She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She has always been described as offering the best to her children, and as a fighter who is dedicated to her home. She is a woman with many virtues, since despite her limitations, she has always gotten ahead. She makes comales out of clay to sell and also grows basic grains. Every morning she gets to eager to get ahead. That is why on this occasion she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to do some home improvement, which is what she is interested in at this time. In addition, for the health if her 3 children, she wants to have the connection for potable water, buying pipes to finalize the plumbing network, as well as sheeting and wood to enlarge a room. She hopes that her loan will go through and to not stop fighting for this to happen.

loans.use: to buy pipes for potable water, as well as sheeting and wood to enlarge a room.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sahiaan

texts.en:
Sahiaan is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of milk sales for many years. She sells high quality milk to the people of her community and counts a good client list. 

At present Sahiaan has four buffaloes, four goats and six calves. She is also involved in the work of animal sales to generate extra income. She is very motivated to provide her family a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. 

This is Sahiaan's third year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of Kashf. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves. In this way her sales will increase, which ultimately helps in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 54 years old, married, and a very responsible mother to her children. She is very determined to manage her general store well, so it will be able to grow. She works very hard at the store, which she has now had for five years. Earning a daily income of 300 PHP with this business, Nora is able to meet her family everyday needs.  

Nora is asking for 11,000 PHP in additional business capital to further expand her product offerings. If she receives the loan, she will be able to buy various grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and condiments.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and condiments.

loans.name: Amber

texts.en:
Amber is an unmarried 22-year-old woman. She has been in the business of crockery sales for two years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls and more. Her father and brother also assist her by selling products to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 20,000. With this capital, she will be able to purchase a greater variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a resultant boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a married, vigorous 50-year-old lady. The man shown in the photo is her son, who has been running a small garment shop nearby his house. 

Parveen’s son buys a wide variety of gentlemen's garments of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates; he then sells them to the people of his community. He has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through his business. 

Parveen requested a loan of PKR 40,000 for her son to buy a wide variety of gentlemen's T-shirts, trousers and jeans in different colors and sizes in order  to attract more customers. Parveen is in her third loan cycle with a good loan history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of gentlemen's T-shirts, trousers and jeans in different colors and sizes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 46-year-old farmer. She is married to Simon, also a farmer, and they are blessed with three children. Margret has been practicing farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.

Margret is applying for her second loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to buy animal feed and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from her farm, she will expand her dairy farming. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and seedlings.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 19º del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, esforzándose el doble por ir mejorando la vida de cada una.
Cintia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a  ser manicurista y pedicurista, lo que se debe destacar es el gran empeño que ella pone por salir adelante, siempre también trata de motivar a sus compañeras a ir mejorando día a día, y por medio de las capacitaciones ir dando un hincapié para hacer mejor sus trabajos.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, algodones, alicates y demás, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Activas (Active Women) is in its 19th communal bank cycle. All of them work and help each other to move ahead. They are taking the poverty elimination survey, in which 2 of them are below the poverty line, trying twice as hard to improve their lives.

Cintia is one of the members. She is a manicurist and pedicurist. What should be stressed is the great effort she puts forth in order to move ahead. She also always tries to motivate her fellow group members to improve day after day, and, through the trainings, to place an emphasis on doing their jobs better.

She is asking for this loan to buy nail polish, acetone, cotton balls, nail clippers and other items. This will help her to carry out her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, acetone, cotton balls, nail clippers, and other items

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase additional groceries to sell to her customers.

Lolita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Lolita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a small-scale garden egg (African fruit) seller in Twifo Prasso (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a teacher.

Adwoa has been working as a garden egg seller for a while now. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of garden eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further, and to ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of garden eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand

loans.name: Maria Carmen Lilian

texts.es: María Carmen Lilian de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella posee una  venta de productos por catalogo y ropa para damas y caballeros, como,  camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos entre otros, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, comercia en diferentes tiendas y zonas de la ciudad que calificó como buenas para su trabajo, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene los mejores precios, con producto de calidad, y un servicio  excelente; María es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños, lo más importante en su vida, es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de los miembros, la casa requiere reparaciones específicamente un cambio de techo, desea empezar la labor lo mas pronto posible para mantener la seguridad en su hogar; siempre su mas grande secreto ha sido la perseverancia y la paciencia pues sabe que así alcanzará el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, laminas, arena, algunas herramientas etc. María Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Carmen Lilian is twenty-four years old. She lives with her life's companion and their children. She has a business selling products via catalog and men's and women's clothing such as shirts, pants, skirts, dresses and more. She has several years' experience in the business and this has given her the opportunity to always obtain better profits. She sells in different stores and ares of the city that she deemed as good for her work. She has a lot of customers because people prefer her, since she has the best prices with quality products and excellent service. María is a dedicated woman who is willing to give everything of herself to make her dreams come true. The most important thing in her life is her family and in the last few weeks the deterioration of her house has affected her family members' peace of mind. The house needs repairs, specifically with a new roof. She wants to start the work as soon as possible to maintain her home's security. Her biggest secret has been perseverance and patience because she knows that that is how she will attain success. She needs to invest but she doesn't have enough capital and that is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy cement, sheeting, sand, some tools, etc.  María Carmen has good payment references and she is taking responsibility for paying off this debt. She has faith that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheeting, sand, and some tools.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She got married 5 years ago but still she has not given birth a baby. Her husband is a contractor and constructs buildings on contract. Recently, he was working on a usual contract but suddenly the bricks were in short supply, and the work had to be stopped. He already invested all his savings in the current contract and does not have the money needed to buy the bricks to finish it.

Nadia has requested a loan of 25,000 Rs. so that her husband will be able to buy bricks and finish the contract. With the profit she and her husband make from finishing the work, Nadia will be able to get better treatment from a specialist doctor so that God may bless her with a baby. Nadia hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and she is very thankful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: to buy bricks for construction.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 46 years old. She lives in the Zestaponi District in Georgia with her large family: her husband, son, daughter-in-law, infant grandson, retired parents-in-law and a brother-in-law. 

Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family's poor living conditions. 

The source of income for the family is an agricultural business. They have 7 cows and produce cheese which is sold locally. Besides that, the family cultivates a plot of land where nuts are grown. They own a vineyard as well. The harvested products are sold at the local open market, but the income is hardly enough for food and every day expenses for an eight-person family. 

Nino requested a loan from Credo, Kiva's field partner, to start up a family business and build a greenhouse. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to vulnurable poor, who do not have access to credit products, as they're regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the loan, Nino will purchase all the building materials for the greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Nino will grow greens and various types of vegetables. The harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Ginna

texts.en:
Ginna is 46 years old and married with two children.

Ginna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household products like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, coffee and other items.

Ginna has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ginna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household products like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, coffee and other items.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 42-year-old married woman. Two years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. 

She buys wide range of clothes from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them to the people of her locality. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She is a mother of four children and is trying hard to fulfill the demands of her family. 

She has gradually improved her business, and now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her increased sales and wishes to utilize part of the revenues to provide a good, quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells cooked rice in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been educated up to the end of junior high school. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Grace has been working in this enterprise for eight years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels of rice. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her cooked rice enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of rice

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 40-year-old from Olkalou. She is single with one child who is 12 years old.

She does mixed farming and has been in this occupation for the past three years. She has applied for a second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET after repaying the previous one successfully. She intends to use the new loan to buy a dairy cow. 

Jemima's hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as focused and determined.  He has taken a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members.  This will enable them to keep enough safe water for domestic use.  He runs a barbershop to earn a living.  This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loans were successfully repaid.  His hopes and dreams are to grow economically and socially.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Candelaria Group

texts.es: María, que está ubicada en el medio de la fotografía, es de tez blanca y pelo rubio, esta con un abrigo negro con puntos blancos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Candelaria, que está ubicado en Concepción VIII región de Chile. En este Banco hay distintos rubro los cuales son venta de ropa, de verduras cortinas de baño, cojines. María tiene su negocio en donde ella confecciona y vende cortinas de baño, ropa de colegio, cojines y manteles. Aprendió en un liceo técnico, del cual salió hace 30 años aproximadamente, y también ha participado en distintos talleres de confección. Lo que más problemas le ha traído a su negocio ha sido la falta de dinero para seguir manteniéndolo. Ella espera para poder ocupar el préstamo en comprar insumos para su trabajo que son hilos, telas, blondas. Espera que le vaya muy bien, ya que ha pesar de no tener dinero para comprar los insumos mucha gente le ha hecho encargos y ella solo espera contar con el dinero para empezar. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder participar en Fon Esperanza es el hecho de contar con una excelente asesora de Banco Comunal, quien es una persona muy amable y preocupada por todas las personas del Banco Comunal, además de contar con un muy buen grupo de personas.
texts.en: María belongs to the Candelaria communal bank located in the Concepción VIII region of Chile. She is in the middle of this photograph, with white skin and blonde hair and a black raincoat with white dots. The members of the bank do different types of work such as selling clothing, vegetables, shower curtains, and cushions. María has a business making and selling shower curtains, school uniforms, cushions, and tablecloths. She learned the work at a technical high school, from which she graduated approximately 30 years ago, and she has also worked at different tailoring businesses. What has given her business the most trouble is the lack of money to keep it going. She hopes to be able to use the loan to buy supplies for her work, which are thread, fabric, and lace. She hopes that it goes very well for her, since despite not having money to buy the supplies, many people have ordered from her and she is only waiting to have the money to start. What she has liked most about being able to participate in Fondo Esperanza is the fact that they have an excellent communal bank advisor who is a very kind person who cares about all the people in the communal bank, as well as having a very good group of people.

loans.use: to buy fabric and lace

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en:
Kieu was born in 1991.  She lives in Nam Dinh.  She is majoring in preventative medicine at ThaiBinh Medical University (http://www.tbmc.edu.vn/).  Her course lasts six years and she will graduate in 2015.  Kieu’s family has five members.  She is the first person in her family to graduate from high school and receive a higher education.  

Her parent sells fruit in a market to earn a living.  Her family’s income is about 7,000,000 VND per month.  Kieu has a passion with her major.  She wishes she could become a doctor to cure everyone.  She wants to complete this university’s course.  She understands that learning will help her have opportunities to get a high-paying job to assist her parent. 

She wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay for her educational fees.  Besides the educational fees, she also lacks money to buy a computer to support her studying.  Through this program, she wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program.  This program has individually helped her education as well as the Vietnamese’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for higher education fees.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is married with 3 children. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school. Currently, Afia sells bread and cakes in Twifo Prasso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 10 years now. Her husband is a driver. Afia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Afia will use the loan to increase her existing bread and cake capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Afia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing bread and cake capacity

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a small-scale baker in Twifo Prasso, near Cape Coast.  She has had formal education through the 6th grade.  She is married to a carpenter and has 4 children.  Yaa has been working as a baker for close to 15 years.  Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and to pay for their children’s school fees.  She plans on using her loan to purchase additional bread in order to meet rising customer demands.  She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a baking stand.  This will help her to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: This marks Susan's second borrowing to finance her butcher shop business. She will use the requested loan to purchase white and red meat for her butchery, given that this is the Muslim festive season. Her business is doing well and has been servicing her loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy meat for her butchery

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 24-year-old single man who lives in the city of Ibb, Yemen. He is involved in sales. He leases a space where he opened a phone accessories business. He started his business with a small amount of capital repairing mobile phones, and then he developed his business to open a phone accessories shop. 

Salah intends to expand his business, but his saved amount is not enough. He is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy phone accessories and related goods in order to increase his capital. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and related goods.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
After graduating Class Six, Yaa decided to set up her own bread and drink business in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). 

With a number of years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. Therefore, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more ingredients to make bread and drinks for resale. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a driver, with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her to purchase more ingredients to make bread and drinks for resale

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 56-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and a mother of two children. Her husband is a laborer and his income is not enough to fulfill household expenditures alone. So one year ago, she started her own business of clothing sales. 

Shehnaz buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates; she then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers.  

She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Safaida

texts.en:
Safaida is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing the store's stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Safaida is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya,a very fertile area for agriculture production. He is married and has four children. He has practiced farming for 25 years. His main source of income is milk, bananas and tea, which he sells in the local market.

He has requested a loan of.42,000 KES for purchasing a dairy cow which will increase milk production. Dairy farming is a very marketable area and thus his income base will increase due to increase in production. This loan will help him to improve his family's living standards. His major challenge is lack of a good market for his products. In five years time, he wants to specialize in dairy farming.

Wilson says that Juhudi Kilimo has affordable interest rates for small scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 40-year-old married woman. She is happily doing business in shoe making with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She beautifully makes shoes in different colors, designs and sizes at home, and then her husband sells them in the local market at reasonable prices. By this time, they have attained a regular list of customers and make enough to earn income for the family. To cope with the increasing demand of their customers, Shazia requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase leather material, plastic soles and heels in different sizes with more spools of threads in various colors to increase her production. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase leather material, plastic soles and heels in different sizes with more spools of threads in various colors

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a 26-year-old shop retailer and the owner of a motorcycle used for transportation in Mariakani Kenya. She is a married mother of three children.who has been in business for the last four years and has done great with the support of her husband.

This marks her fourth loan to finance her business from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to purchase inventory of wheat and maize flour, sugar, milk, cooking fat and paraffin. She hopes to expand her business and own several motorbikes in future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat and maize flour, sugar, milk, cooking fat and paraffin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap iron sheets, disposed wire and empty containers

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en: Madiha, age 34, is an energetic married woman. She is actively involved in the business of flower selling for many years. She purchases stock of different flowers and after making garlands she sells them in her community. She also gets orders for events like weddings and birthdays and earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenses. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy stock of different flowers such as red roses, jasmine and lilies with some reels of white thread. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and will generate more revenue. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of different flowers such as red roses, jasmine and lilies with some reels of white thread

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of envelope making for many years. She makes a large quantity of envelopes in different sizes at home and sells them in the local market. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Razia requested a loan of 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper with some glue and floral tapes to increase her sales. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good loan history. She expects an increase in her business income and wishes to spend a part of the profits to provide a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper with some glue and floral tape

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 43-year-old married father of three children. To earn his living, he owns a small grocery shop where he sells the best kind of vegetables and fruits, and has been working in this field for three years now. 

However, in order to register his pickup to use it for transporting his fruits and vegetables from the wholesale market, he has to legalize his business and secure it into the government's papers. So, he contacted Al Majmoua and decided to acquire the loan that would support him in covering the fees of registration. Therefore, this will allow him to purchase merchandise in big quantities and at lower costs, which will lead to increasing his profit.

loans.use: to pay his pickup's and company's registeration fees

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 3 and a half years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is a driver and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. That is why Shehnaz is working hard to contribute in the family income.  She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to increase her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates for resale. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates for resale

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria lives in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has four children. She has been involved in farming for 25 years. Her main sources of income are bananas, maize, tea leaves, and beans.

She has requested Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 60,000 KES for purchasing water pumps and pipes that will help her in irrigating her farm. This will help increase her production and thus increase her income base. Thus more income will give her family better living standards. The major challenge she faces is inadequate funds. In five years she wants to have a fully equipped cereal shop.

Silveria says that she is determined to grow with the support that Juhudi Kilimo has given her.

loans.use: to purchase water pumps and pipes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married lady aged 46 years old.  Her spouse is a business man and adds income to the family.  They are blessed with 3 children aged 18, 13 and 5 years old.  She runs a hotel business in Kampi Ya Moto location and has been in operation for over a period of 3 years earning an income of 20,000 KES.

She has borrowed her second loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD., which she intends to use to purchase utensils and other equipment that will enable her to boost her business.  The profits she will earn will be used to reinvest in to the business.

She hopes for growth in her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and utensils for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods (pastries, soft drinks, dairy products, cleanings products, and so on).

loans.name: Alba Leticia

texts.es: Alba Leticia de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; ella se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, específicamente el güisquil, tiene varios años de experiencia en el rubro y siembre obtiene buenas cosechas, que le han dado la oportunidad de mantener  las mejores ganancias, el terreno de siembra es adecuado y fértil y está ubicado en un lugar que calificó como bueno para su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque vende las mejores hortalizas de la zona además tiene los mejores precios, y el servicio es inigualable; Alba es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus metas, lo más importante para ella es su familia por eso trabaja duro para darles lo mejor, está preocupada pues su vivienda está un poco pequeña y eso ha incomodado a todos en el hogar, la casa necesita la construcción de un cuarto para lograr mas espacio y quiere realizarlas lo más pronto posible para la comodidad de todos. Su más grande secreto es la motivación de salir adelante, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito; necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena, herramientas etc. Alba Leticia es conocida en el lugar por su buena paga, se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 24-year-old Alba Leticia lives with her partner. She makes a living by planting vegetables, specifically chayote. She has several years of experience in this and she always has good harvests, which have given her the opportunity to have the best profits. The land she has for planting is adequate and fertile, and is located in an area considered to be good for planting vegetables. She already has many customers as people prefer her business because she sells the best vegetables in the area, has the best prices, and her service is unequalled. Alba is a woman who is dedicated to her work and prepared to give her all to accomplish her goals. The most important thing to her is her family, and for this reason she works hard to give them the best. She is worried because her home is a little small and this has caused discomfort to everyone in her home. The house needs another room added on to it in order to create more space. Alba wants to do this as soon as possible for everyone’s comfort. Her greatest secret is her motivation to get ahead; she knows that she will succeed if she is motivated. She needs to invest in building materials but does not have enough capital, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which will allow her to buy cement, bricks, sand, tools, etc. Alba Leticia is known in the area for her good credit history. She has taken responsibility for settling the debt and hopes that she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and tools

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. Four years back, she started her business of cloth sales to contribute to the family income, as her husband and one son were the only earners of the family, and it was very tough for Rukhsana to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband and son. 

She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then resells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her locality. 

Rukhsana requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth of the summer season by taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth of the summer season.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José Santos de treinta y cuatro años  de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos menores de edad; Él se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, tiene varios años con el negocio y es muy rentable, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, el lugar donde comercia esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad, por lo que ya tiene clientela fija que lo prefiere por los buenos precios, la calidad y el servicio excelente; José es un hombre dedicado a su labor y a toda su familia son las dos cosas más importantes en su vida, se esfuerza todos los días por ofrecerles un futuro mejor y una vida digna, está pendiente de todo lo que necesitan, en los últimos meses la casa ha tenido deterioros y necesita reparaciones para seguridad y comodidad de los que la habitan, pero José no cuenta con el suficiente capital que lo respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, cemento, ladrillo, etc. José Santos tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la confianza que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena como se la merecen.
texts.en: 34-year-old José Santos lives with his partner and his underaged children. He makes a living by buying and selling wood. He has several years of experience in his business and it is very profitable. He has acquired a lot of experience in sales. His business is located in his home and is very well-known by people in the area. He already has regular customers who prefer his business for its good prices, its quality, and its excellent service. Jose is a man who is dedicated to his work and to his whole family; they are the two most important things in his life. He strives every day to offer them a better future and a decent life, and is always attentive to their needs. In recent months the house has deteriorated and it needs repairs so that its inhabitants are safe and comfortable, but José does not have enough capital for backing. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from FUSAI, which will allow him to buy tiles, cement, bricks, etc. José Santos has a good credit history and he is very responsible. He says he will be able to settle the debt in the established period and is confident that he will offer his family the full life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, and bricks

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: Fausto de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida; Él posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y variedades además es jornalero se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años en su labor y ha ganado mucha experiencia en el comercio que le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, ya tiene clientela fija que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden del cliente, Fausto es responsable, humilde y muy luchador siempre está buscando las mejores alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito; es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo y a toda su familia porque quiere ofrecerles una vida digna, en las ultimas semanas decidió mejorar la vivienda para mayor comodidad, necesita construir un muro y además poner piso, pero Fausto no cuenta con capital que lo respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar arena, cemento, hierro, ladrillo de piso, etc., Fausto tiene buenas referencias de pago y está feliz con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el período establecido y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: 46-year-old Fausto lives with his partner. He owns a store where he sells staples and other items. He is also a day labourer who plants corn and beans. He has done this work for many years and has gained a lot of experience in trade, which allows him to obtain very good profits. He now has regular customers who prefer his business for the quality of his products, the reasonable prices, and the unequalled service. Fausto is responsible, humble, and a fighter. His is always looking for the best options which will allow him to succeed. He is dedicated to his work and to his family because he wants to give them a decent life. In recent weeks he has decided to improve his home for greater comfort. He needs to build a wall and put down a floor, but Fausto does not have the capital he needs. For this reason, Fausto decided to request a loan from FUSAI, which will allow him to purchase sand, cement, iron, brick flooring, etc. Fausto has a good credit history and is happy with the help. He says he will be able to settle the debt in the established period and at the same time he will give his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, and flooring

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan, aged 61 and a widower, is a hardworking man who has been involved in fishing activities for years to make enough income to provide food for his family. Seeing the hard situations in the family, most of Chhan’s children decided to start working to financially help their father. Three of them are working in garment factories. 

The previous loan that he received helped him to buy a motorcycle for his employed children commuting to their workplaces. Only one motorcycle, however, does not provide the full support they needed because they have separate work locations. In this regard, he is now requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy one motorcycle more to encourage his children to work without having to pay for a taxi monthly. He appreciates the loan support.

loans.use: to buy one motorcycle more to encourage his children to work without having to pay for a taxi monthly.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 45-year-old who is in the motorcycle-transport business and is a shop retailer in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is a married father whose wife earns additional income; together, they support eight people, and they have been into these businesses for the last two years, doing well.

This marks his second borrowing after successfully servicing the previous loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the requested money to service his motorcycles and purchase stock for his retail shop, and the anticipated profit will be used to service his loan. He hopes to be successful in life.

loans.use: to service his motorcycles and purchase stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 29 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el compañero y con los hijos en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Mayra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es tener dinero para poder amoblar la casa ya que le falta muchas cosas importantes, en los tiempos libres le gusta ver las novelas de las ocho de la noche.
texts.en:
Mayra is 29 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. She lives with her companion and their children in the precinct of Terrenal, which is in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, Los Ríos Province.

Mayra is a member of the Communal Bank “Terrenal”, which is located in the precinct of Terrenal in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members engage in farm work and raising livestock.

Mayra is a farmer who grows corn and rice. With this loan, she will buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost, and insecticides so that she can prevent pests and diseases. Her purchases will be conducted in the city of Pueblo Viejo. Her dream is to have money to furnish her house since it is lacking many important things.

In her free time, Mayra enjoys watching the soap operas that come on at 8:00 P.M.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and insecticides.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir generando ingresos económicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar ropa para damas y caballeros, tales como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, entre otros.
Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que gracias al crédito anterior obtuvo ganancias favorables y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado porque cuenta con más oportunidades para prepararse académicamente.
texts.en:
Teresa is presenting a new loan request because she needs more operating capital so that she can continue generating income. This investment will help her to buy clothes for women and men such as blouses, shirts, trousers, and other items.

Her financial condition has improved. Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to earn a favorable income. Her family circumstances are optimal because her children have more opportunities to prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, trousers, and other articles of clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years and very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and needles to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small garment factory in which he sews pants, shirts, trousers and T-shirts. He takes the orders in large quantities and sews the garments in the specific given period. He has been sewing the garments since 2008, without an overlock machine. He had been taking the garments to outside over-lock services and paying a healthy amount against these services. Now he wants to buy an over-lock machine of his own, but he does not have the finances to purchase the machine.

Nazia requested a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so that he would be able to buy an over-lock machine and save money.

Nazia is in her fifth loan cycle, and she has shown excellent repayment behavior. This time, she is representing herself as a group leader due to her excellent repayment behavior. 

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

Note: Nazia is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine for the small garment factory.

loans.name: Kipkosgei

texts.en:
Kipkosgei is a married man, aged 38, who is blessed with five children. He runs a business of selling dry cereals in the Chepsigot location and has been in the business for a period of seven years, earning an income of 32,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) monthly.

He is now servicing his seventh loan of 100,000 KES from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase stock of dry maize for resale and also pay the transport charges. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and increase stock of cereals.

His dream is to see his business expand.

loans.use: to purchase stock of dry maize and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Majeed

texts.en:
Majid is a 47-year-old single man living on a farm in a village in Mount Lebanon. In fact, he earns his living by planting, harvesting and selling fruits and vegetables. He also provides for one of his family members.

Majid is a hard worker with a certain handicap that makes farming a bit of a challenge to him. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetables in addition to organic products that he delivers to specified customers. He needs the loan in order to purchase seeds, plastic boxes and necessary updated tools, which are materials that would facilitate the farming and trading process for him. 

As for the future, Majid wishes to acquire a bigger part of land in order to maximize his benefit, and to own a special storage fridge to keep his products fresh.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic boxes and necessary updated tools.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel tiene 24 años, tiene un hijito de un añito de edad, se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de cotillones y piñatas para todo tipo de acontecimientos ya sea bautizos matrimonios, fiestas de quince años, ella entrega a distintas tiendas, mercados, y también le hacen pedido para el decorado de fiestas,  es una cliente nueva de la institución , con el dinero del crédito comprara  material para la fabricación de piñatas y cotillones y así brindar variedad de cotillones a sus clientes , La Sra. Maribel se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brinda para crecer en su negocio y de esta manera genera más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maribel is 24 years old and has a one-year-old son. She makes and sells party favors and piñatas for all types of events such as baptisms, weddings, and quinceañeras. Maribel delivers her products to different stores and markets, but she also gets requests to handle party decorations.

Maribel is a new client of Emprender. With the money from this loan, she will buy materials for making piñatas and party favors so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers. Sra. Maribel is very grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can grow her business and generate more income for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making piñatas and party favors.

loans.name: Blemaa's Group

texts.en:
Blema is a group composed of 12 Ghanaian women and 1 man living in Teshie-Accra. They decided to join hands and form the group in order to acquire a loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana, and to support each other financially.

Theresa is the featured member of the group. She is a 54-year-old married mother of two children, standing third from left in the photograph. She sells sandals and slippers. Her husband is also a businessman. However, their combined revenue is not sufficient to provide enough to sustain the family and their businesses.

Furthermore, Theresa's children are of school-going ages, so she needs a loan to sell enough to cover her childrens' fees and other expenses. She will use her share of the loan to purchase two slippers and sandals, as well as supplies for her customers, therefore expanding her business. 

As for the other group members, they are in the sales of fish, fruits, plastic baskets, rice, flour, oil, and grocery items, all of which are showcased in the photograph. Together they need a total amount of 5,200 Ghana Cedis (GHS) to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase two slippers and sandals, as well as supplies for her customers, therefore expanding her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single mother of three children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin and brother). She has a business tailoring and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread. She generates additional income through rental houses. She works in a shop six days  every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own three more sewing machines and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material and thread.

loans.name: Rosa Merari

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 23 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y en compañía de su compañero de hogar viven humilde mente ya agradece a DIOS por tener una familia bien consolidada. Sus hijos el primero con una edad de 4 años y el menor con 18 meses dependen de ellos en todos los aspectos por lo cual juntos como pareja trabajan arduamente en sus cultivos de café, maíz y frijoles ya que es el único patrimonio para darles el sustento a sus hijos. Sus cultivos de café están a la par de su casa por lo cual les es fácil dar el mantenimiento y asistencia técnica como: poda, limpieza, fertilización, entre otros.

Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para mejorar su producción de café comprando los insumos necesarios para su mantenimiento y atención. 

Ella espera que se le apoye con su solicitud ya que es el único medio de ingreso para que ellos puedan cumplir con sus sueños en su familia poder apoyar a sus hijos el día que ellos estudien y formar un patrimonio sólido para su futuro. De esta manera quedara satisfecha y con mucha puntualidad cumplirá con el compromiso para poder seguir gozando de sus beneficios y demás servicios.
texts.en:
Rosa is 23 years old. She is mother to two children. She lives with her partner and they live very simply. She gives thanks to God for her family. Their children, the first of which is 4 years old and the youngest of which is 18 month, are completely dependent on them so the couple works hard growing their coffee, corn, and bean crops because this is the only source of income they have to support their children. Their coffee plants are located next to their house, so it’s easy to maintain them via: pruning, weeding, and fertilizing, among other things. 

She is now requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL communal bank to improve her production of coffee by buying the inputs necessary for its maintenance and attention. 

She hopes that they will support her request because it is the only source of income that will allow them to achieve their dreams. As a family, they want to support their children in their studies and give them a solid base for their future. In this way, she would be very happy and will make her repayments punctually so that she can continue enjoying the benefits and other services.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and folial fertilizers, among other thing for her crops.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le permitirá comprar harina, pan francés, aceite, pan dulce, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable,  las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado,  ya que le permitió aumentar sus utilidades y mejoro su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan has chosen to request another loan because he needs more operating capital. This investment will enable him to buy flour, French bread, oil, sweet bread, and other items.

The effect of his previous loan was favorable. His financial condition and family circumstances have become optimal. In addition, he has increased his profits and improved his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, French bread, oil, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Doña Maria es originaria de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante. Ella se dedica a vender productos congelados como: pollo, embutidos, Papas precosidas etc. Le ha ido muy bien ha surtido de nuevos productos comestibles su negocio poco a poco ha ido creciendo como comerciante  logrando su meta propuesta, logrando vender nuevos productos. Este nuevo crédito  lo quiere para comprar granos básicos como: Arroz, azúcar, frijol, aceite, embutidos y frezer.  Su meta futuro es seguir creciendo y brindando satisfacción a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a native of Estelí and she is a shopkeeper. She sells frozen goods such as: chicken, lunchmeats, pre-cooked potatoes, etc. Her business has done well, she has stocked new groceries at her business and has grown bit by bit as a businesswoman achieving her proposed goal of selling new products.

She would like a new loan to purchase a freezer and to purchase basic goods such as: rice, sugar, beans, oil and lunchmeats.

Her goal for the future is to continue expanding and bringing satisfaction to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and basic goods such as: rice, sugar, beans, oil and lunchmeats.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: This is thirty-one-year-old Christiana. She is married and has three children aged four, seven and twelve. She has one additional dependent who lives with her, a younger sister, to help with her education. In 1998, Christiana established her plastic slippers, sandals and shoes business. The business started after she dropped out of school to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 930,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Christiana has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional plastic slippers and shoes. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, Christiana plans to increase the size of the stall and add stock and hopes to be able to take care of her children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for plastic slippers and shoes.

loans.name: Ciduar

texts.es:
Delmar es un joven de 24 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultivan productos como algodón, paprika, esparrago, entre otros.  Desde muy pequeño Delmar aprendió a trabajar ya que tenia la necesidad de apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, es por ello que no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria, ya que solo estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria.

Delmar trabaja cada día como estibador y ayudante en un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en el mercado de la ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, a pesar de lo duro del trabajo Delmar se siente orgullosos, ya que es un trabajo honrado y con el cual puede salir adelante.

Delmar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la reparación del techo de su vivienda, por ello comprara materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, entre otros, con lo cual podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder tener mayor seguridad, así el seguirá trabajando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener un gran empresa y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Delmar is 24 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having a warm and welcoming climate. People there work in agriculture, especially products such as cotton, paprika, and asparagus, among other things. Delmar has worked from the time he was very young, since he needed to help his parent with the household expenses. He wasn’t able to study in college because he only finished fifth grade.

Delmar works every day as a porter and assistant in a small grocery store in the city. He works around 9 hours per day. Despite how hard his job is, Delmar is proud because it is an honest job and one where he can get ahead. 

Delmar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the help they have provided that he will be able to repair the roof of his house. He will buy construction materials such a cement and sand, among other things. He will be able to have a better quality of life and also be safer. He will continue working every day so can achieve his greatest dream: “To have a big business and study at university.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his roof.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Maria  es originaria de Estelí. De oficio comerciante, es dueña de pulpería. Ella esta agradecida con kiva ya que  su primer crédito  lo utilizo para surtir su negocio, le ha ido muy bien, sus ventas mejoraron, logro satisfacer las demandas que tenía.
Ahora ella está solicitando este nuevo crédito para comprar productos tales como: granos básicos, arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite y cosméticos. Su meta futuro es tener la mejor pulpería de su sector y  obtener mejores  ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is a native of Estelí. She is a merchant who owns her own "pulpería" [small convenience store]. 

She is grateful to Kiva because she was able to use her first loan to stock her business. Things have gone well, her sales improved and she was able to satisfy the demand she had.

She now requests a new loan to purchase products such as basic grains, rice, beans, sugar and oil; and cosmetics. 

Her goal for the future is to have the best "pulpería" in the area and to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase products such as grains, rice, beans, sugar, oil and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and other supplies for her potato crops.

loans.name: Domitila Aurora

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, Domitila es una joven que ha atravesado momentos difíciles pero a pesar de ello sigue luchando por salir adelante, ya que es madre de un pequeño de 5 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y por el cual daría la vida con tal de darle lo mejor.
 
Cada día  Domitila trabaja para poder sacar adelante a su pequeño, ella labora como obrera de un fundo agrícola de su distrito, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al dia, a pesar de lo tedioso y cansado de su labor sigue adelante ya que de ello depende que su hijo tenga una vida digna.

Domitila esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá  comprar materiales de construcción como cemento y arena para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente colocar un piso de cemento, ya que actualmente solo es de tierra; de esta manera seguirá trabajando y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a s hijo y una buena calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Domitila is 29 years old and lives in the city of Imperial. Domitila is a young woman who has gone through a difficult time, but in spite of this she continues to strive to get ahead since she is the mother of a small five-year-old son, whom she loves very much and for whom she would give her life in order to give him the best.

Every day Domitila works in order to support her child. She works as a farm worker in her district for approximately nine hours a day. Despite the tedium and exhaustion of her work, she continues working because she depends on her job as a means to give her son a decent life.

Domitila is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy building materials, such as cement and sand, in order to make improvements to her home like putting down a cement floor, since currently it is only an earth floor. In this way she will continue working and she will be able to continue fighting in order to make her greatest dream of “giving her son a profession and a good quality of life” a reality.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Abdul Rahman.  He is married and has four children who are 8, 14, 21 and 33 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help with the house chores. In 2002, Abdul Rahman established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant after retiring from the civil service. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,410,060 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Abdul Rahman has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy used housedresses. He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and raise his profits. In the future, Abdul Rahman plans to expand the business to the outskirts of town. He hopes to be able to educate the children with the profit raised from the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Redwan

texts.en: Redwan is a 20-year-old man. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. His educational background is secondary school. His business is in a high traffic area, which makes it a main source of income. He started working in a shoe store with his cousin. Two years ago, he bought this store from his cousin. He already attracted numbers of regular customers and improved the family's income. The business has been successful in the most recent years. Therefore, he is planning to expand the business. So he is requesting a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB to buy ladies' and men's shoes to increase his income and have more customers. In the future, Redwan hopes to increase his profit and improve his living conditions as well as to buy a car, which will facilitate his work.

loans.use: to buy ladies' and men's shoes to sell

loans.name: Thaimu

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Thaimu.  He is married and has three children aged three, four and eight years old. He has two additional dependents who live with him to help his younger sisters with their education.  In 2002, Thaimu established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,712,190 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Thaimu has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional bales of used men's vests. He hopes that this loan can improve his stock and raise his profits. In the future, Thaimu plans to open outlets and improve the store that has been rented. He started the business with one bale of used clothing and now has started selling at wholesale. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has two children who are five and nine years old. In 1999, Aminata established her plastic products (sandals, slippers, shoes and sneakers) business. She started the business to help her husband in running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,915,950 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Aminata has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional slippers and sandals. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, Aminata plans to move to a shop and expand the business to used clothing. She hopes to be able to take care of her children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nuvia Marleni

texts.es:
Nuvia tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijas. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a comercializar con mariscos, es una actividad que desarrolla en varias comunidades aledañas a donde ella vive. Compra por grandes cantidades el marisco en la playa y posteriormente se traslada en bus a varias comunidades para visitar casa por casa y ofrecer el producto. Dicha rutas de venta la organiza por las mañanas y en hora del medio día ya ha finalizado al conocer ya muchos clientes.

Se traslada a tempranas horas de la mañana hacia la zona costera de la ciudad. Ella tiene varios proveedores en la zona a quienes le llama antes de realizar el viaje y consultar que tipo de producto a salido y en base a eso saber cuanto producto comprara y a que comunidades visitara para revenderlo.                                 

El crédito tendrá un doble propósito el primero es cancelar una deuda con una entidad financiera que cobra intereses bastante altos en comparación con Fundación Campo y que la señora de se ha dado cuenta que a pesar de su esfuerzo de pagar semanalmente su saldo no se mueve; porque paga solamente lo que son intereses y Con lo restante comprara mas mariscos.

Con el crédito se cubrirá la necesidad de pagar el crédito que tiene con intereses altos y la principal necesidad que solicita que se le apoye para mantener a flote su negocio. Ella muestra deseo de seguir con su negocio porque ha observado que puede obtener buenos ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Nubia actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijas en una casa construida de láminas y necesita también a base de las ganancias de su negocio poder mejor las condiciones de su casa (piso, techo, etc.) para poder tener las condiciones mínimas de seguridad.  

su sueño mas importante es  lograr que sus hijas se preparen y estudien, en vista que ella no tubo esa oportunidad, desde muy pequeña trabajo para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. 

Por todo lo anterior ella se esfuerza por darle lo necesario para que ellos puedan asistir a la escuela y poco a poco prepararse para tener una oportunidad en el futuro y ser personas de provecho en la sociedad.
texts.en: Nuvia is 25 years old, married, and has three children. She has been selling seafod for 10 years in neighbouring villages. She buys seafood in large quantities at the beach and then takes the bus to several villages to sell her wares door to door. She does this in the morning, which usually allows her to be done by midday, since she has many regular customers. She goes to the coastal area of the city very early in the morning to meet with her providers, whom she calls before travelling in order to know what they caught. She can thus determine how much seafood she will buy and where to sell it. The loan she is taking out will serve a double purpose. Nuvia will use it to reimburse another, higher-interest loan to another lending institution. In spite of her weekly repayments, Nuvia noticed that all she is doing is repaying the interest, and not the principal, owing to which the remaining amount of debt stays the same. With the rest of the sum, she will buy more seafood to sell. Thus, the loan will help her face her two main current challenges: alleviating her debt burden and acquiring more supplies for her business. Nuvia is very keen to keep the business going because she says that it can provide a hefty income with which to pay for household expenses. The house where Nuvia and her family live is made of sheet metal and she needs the income from her business in order to improve her basic living conditions by installing a new roof and a new floor. Her greatest dream is to see her daughters succeed in school, since she herself did not have the opportunity to study. Nuvia has been working since she was very young in order to help her family with household expenses. This is why she wants her daughters to have a different life and better prospects for their future thanks to education.

loans.use: to reimburse another, higher-interest loan, and to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Musu.  She is married and has two children who are two and six years old. In 2006, Musu established her earrings, chains, blouses, trousers, baby clothing and powder business. She began her business to help her husband with running the affairs of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,590,950 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Musu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to pay for additional blouses, slippers and bags. She hopes that this loan can improve her stock and increase her profit. In the future, Musu plans to expand the business to a shop. She hopes to be able to raise enough profit to take care of the children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy blouses, slippers and bags to sell

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.ru: Бибираджабу 42 года. Она мать одиночка. Бибираджаб имеет 2 дочерей. Им 15 и 18 лет. Бибираджаб не смотря на плохое состояние здоровья, упорно работает для обеспечения своих дочерей. Им не на кого надеется. Бибираджаб более 10 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она занимается купле продажей продуктов питания. Бибираджаб продает такие продукты как хлеб, масло, сахар, картошка и т.п. Она старается предоставить своим клиентам продукты с высшим качеством, так как здоровое питание является гарантом здорового образа жизни. Бибираджаб желает всем людям здоровья. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получать больше дохода, так как ее дочери выросли и требуют больше благ. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2800 долларов США для покупки продуктов питания для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bibirajab is 42 years old. She is a single mother.  She has 2 daughters. They are 15 and 18 years old.  Despite her poor health, Bibirajab works tirelessly to provide for her daughters. They have no one to rely on. For more than 10 years, Bibirajab has been operating her own business. She buys and sells food products. Bibirajab sells food products such as bread, butter, sugar, potatoes, and so forth. She tries to provide her customers with products of the highest quality, because healthy eating guarantees a healthy lifestyle. Bibirajab wishes everyone to have good health. She wants to increase her working capitol and thus increase her income, as her daughters are growing and in need of more. She has requested a loan in the amount of 2800 U.S. dollars for the purchase of food products to expand her business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products to increase working capital

loans.name: Gulafsho

texts.ru: Гулафшо трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Ее сыну 14 лет и дочери 9 лет. Ее муж занимается перевозкой грузов. Гулафшо всегда мечтала иметь собственное дело. После замужества сама жизнь заставила ее начать свой бизнес. При поддержке мужа, она начала бизнес купле продажей обувью. Вначале у нее было маленький оборотный капитал. Гулафшо упорно трудилась и благодаря ее терпению и труду сегодня ее бизнес развевается. Гулафшо хочет увеличить оборотный капитал для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2100 долларов США для покупки обуви для расширения ассортимента товара. Этот займ для нее является 5 циклом, и она имеет хорошею кредитную историю. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulafsho is a hardworking woman.  She is 43 years old.  She is married and is raising two minor children. Her son is 14 years old and her daughter is 9. Her husband works transporting cargo. Gulafsho has always dreamed of having her own business. After marriage, life has forced her to start a business. Before the support of her husband, she started a business buying and selling shoes. At first, she had little working capitol. Gulafsho worked hard, and due to her patience and hard work, her business is now growing. Gulafsho wants to increase her working capitol for the new season, but does not have enough money.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 2100 U.S. dollars for the purchase of shoes in order to increase the variety of merchandise she offers.  This is her 5th loan cycle for her, and she has a good credit history.  She awaits your kindness.
