loans.use: To buy shoes for widening the assortment of goods

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de limpieza de casa en casa y también trabaja con el cultivo de maíz dichas actividades la realiza desde hace 10 años. Él cultiva 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, la cosecha lo utiliza para el consumo de su familia y otra parte la comercializa con vecinos y amigos. El cultiva junto con la ayuda de un hijo quien le apoya en el trabajo agrícola y en velar porque que la producción sea la mejor.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas para la temporada de postrera y poder cultivar junto a su hijo.

Con el préstamo, cultivara un año mas y con su esfuerzo y en espera de tener un buen invierno el podrá cosechar y obtener ganancias que le ayuden a cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia.

Sin la inversión,  se hubiese limitado a no cultivar o en menos cantidad de lo que va a cultivar. A futuro tiene como meta solicitar un crédito más grande y lo piensa invertir en mejorar a la vivienda y mejorar las condiciones de la misma.
texts.en: Marcos is 50 years old, married, and has two children. He sells cleaning supplies from door to door and also grows sweetcorn. He has been doing both for ten years. His sweetcorn field has a surface of 10,500 square metres. The harvest feeds the family, with the surplus being sold to neighbours and friends. Marcos tills the land with the help of his son: together, they take care of the harvest and do their best to have as productive a farm as possible. The loan Marcos asks for will be used to to buy fertiliser, pesticides, and herbicides for the last harvest of the season. He and his son will thus be able to cultivate the land for one more year. They hope for a clement winter in order to be able to harvest properly and generate enough income to pay for household expenses. Without the loan, Marcos would have had to sow a smaller area, or even not at all. His goals for the future are to take out a more substantial loan in order to improve his house and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, pesticides, and herbicides for the last harvest of the season.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Fizuli region with his family. Ismayil is 43 years old, married, and has two children, a daughter and a son. His daughter goes to school and his son goes to university. His daughter wants to be a journalist. 

Ismayil started his business nine years ago raising sheep. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to repair his farm. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Ismayil wants to have more sheep and to buy calves for his farm. This will be more profitable for his business. Ismayil is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his farm

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 62 years old and lives in the littoral town of Kobuleti. She is unmarried, retired and lives with her sister. Tamar owns commercial space and a flat in Kobuleti and rents them. The rent is source of income for Tamar and her sister. 

Tamar wants to supplement her family's income by renovating her second house so she can rent it out seasonally. Summertime is the high season in Kobuleti and several people have already expressed an interest in living there, but she has been unable to get a loan from several local financial institutions to pay for renovations. That is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva and Credo, which help people who do not qualify for conventional loans. She will use the loan to buy the materials she needs to renovate her house. Tamar hopes that renting out the rooms will be profitable and increase her income so that she and her sister can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate the house so that it can be rented out.

loans.name: Emilio Nibar

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 68 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad, de clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, entre otros. Emilio tiene una alegría y vitalidad contagiante, con la cual sale adelante cada día y le permite trabajar con mucho entusiasmo en su negocio de elaboración de esteras, negocio que le permite poder tener ingresos para vivir y poder salir adelante junto a su esposa.

Emilio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar os gastos para poder tramitar su título de propiedad, con lo cual podrá brindarle seguridad a su familia, de esta manera trabajara mejor y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en: Emilio is 68 years old. He lives in the town of Ica, known for its warm and welcoming climate, its cotton fields, and its vineyards. Emilio's happiness and joy are infectious and they help him pull through every day. He works enthusiastically at his rush-mat business, thanks to which he derives the income needed to support himself and his wife. Emilio is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since, thanks to their help, he will be able to pay for his property title fees, which means security for his family. He will thus be able to work with a greater peace of mind and to keep fighting to make his greatest dream come true: "I want to make sure my children learn a proper job".

loans.use: to pay for property title fees.

loans.name: Farangiz

texts.ru: Фарангиз жительница района Носири Хусрав. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем, но еще детей не имеет. Фарангиз живет с мужем, свёкорю и свекровью. У них имеется приусадебный участок земли 0,20 га, на котором выращивается сельскохозяйственная культура. А также в их домашнем хозяйстве имеется две коровы. В настоящий момент Фарангиз вместе с мужем собирается начать животноводческий бизнес. Их интересует купля и продажа крупно-рогатого скота. Фарангиз планирует закупать по 5-голов бычков, откармливать их в течение одного месяца и продавать на скотном рынке. Стартовый капитал Фарангиза составляет 2000 сомони (TJS). Она обратилась за кредитом в размере 2000 долларов США, чтобы реализовать цель. Фарангиз на сумму кредита и сбережения хочет купить 5-голов бычков и корм для скота.
texts.en: Farangiz resides in the Nosiri Khustav region.  She is 26 years old.  She is married but does not yet have children. Farangiz lives with her husband and parents-in-law. They have an adjacent 0.2 hectare piece of land on which they grow crops. They also have two cows in their household.  Currently, Farangiz and her husband are preparing to open a livestock business. They are interested in purchasing and selling cattle. Farangiz plans to purchase 5 heads of cattle, feed them over the course of a month, and then sell them at the livestock market.  The starting capitol for Farangiz is 2000 somons. She has requested a loan in order to meet her goal. Farangiz wants to use the loan and her savings to purchase 5 heads of cattle and livestock feed.

loans.use: to purchase 5 heads of cattle and feed for livestock

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер житель города Куляб, занимающийся скотоводством. Ему 31 год. Он женат и является отцом двоих детей. С ними также живут его отец, мать и братья.  Алишер в течение 5 лет занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Сейчас в его хозяйстве имеется один бык ярославской породы.  Для продвижения деятельности ему необходимо увеличить поголовье скота. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. Алишер на сумму кредита хочет купить двух бычков. Он обычно закупает скот с рынка по дешевой цене и после одного месяца откорма выводит на скотный рынок на продажу. Одновременно Алишер работает на центральном рынке города в пункте денежных операций.
texts.en: Alisher is a resident of the town of Kulyab, engaged in raising livestock. He is 31 years old. He is married and is the father of two children. His father, mother and brothers also live with them. Alisher has 5 years of experience in buying and selling cattle. Now in its economy, there is one bull "Yaroslavl" breed. To promote the activities it is necessary to increase the number of livestock. To that end, he applied for a loan. Alisher on the amount of this loan wants to buy two calves. He usually buys cattle from the market at a cheap price and after one month of feeding displays the cattle market to sell. At the same time, Alisher works in the central market of the city at a bank branch.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Pedro Carlos

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 53 años, vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso en todo el año, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros.  Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su esposa ya que siempre es bueno distraerse de los problemas nos comenta Pedro, en ocasiones le pide a su esposa que le prepare uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Electrónica.

Día a día Pedro trabaja como chofer de taxi, al igual que muchas personas en nuestro país, el trabaja en este tipo de negocio ya que es el único medio en el cual puede solventar a su familia y con él puede salir adelante, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy carismático con los clientes.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y con ello podrá comprar mercadería como fideos, azúcar, atún, entre otros; para iniciar un negocio de venta de abarrotes, con lo cual podrá tener un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar y seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en: Pedro is 53 years old and lives with his wife, with whom he has two children, who are now adults. He lives in Parcona, a place known for its all-year-round warm climate, its cotton fields, its vineyards, and its spice-growing industry. In his spare time, Pedro loves to go for a stroll with his wife, the perfect way, he says, to forget about your problems. He sometimes asks his wife to make him one of his favourites dishes, ceviche (raw fish marinated in lemon). Owing to scarce financial resources, Pedro completed only secondary education, but he would have liked to study electronics. Pedro works day in, day out as a taxi driver, as do many of his compatriots. He works about ten hours a day and can have as many as 40 customers in one day. He attributes his success to his amiability towards customers and to his natural charisma. Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders since this is the second time that they help him. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to buy merchandise, such as pasta, sugar, and tuna, in order to start a new business, namely, a grocery shop. He hopes this will generate more income, which would really come in handy for household expenses. His wish is to keep working and fighting every day to make his greatest dream come true: "I want to have a better life".

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to start a new business.

loans.name: Arcadio José

texts.es: Arcadio, a sus 47 años de edad es padre de 3 hijos y está separado, ya que su pareja lo abandonó, dejándolo a cargo de sus hijos. Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió todas las labores de agricultura, gracias a su padre, quien le enseñó a cultivar tierras cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad. Actualmente posee cultivos de varias especies de ñame y cuando recoge la cosecha, va a venderla a la plaza del pueblo donde reside y, de esta manera ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para darle el sustento a sus hijos. Arcadio es un hombre trabajador, pujante y dedicado a su familia y a su labor por ello solicita el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fungicidas, fertilizantes), con el fin de darle continuidad al cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una mejor cosecha, que pueda vender a un mejor precio en el mercado y así aumentar los ingresos para seguir llevando el alimento a su hogar.  Arcadio sueña con tener muchas tierras con cultivos, que le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo y mejore la estabilidad económica para brindarle a sus hijos una excelente educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Arcadio, 47, has three children in his care since his wife divorced him and left.  He was born and raised in the country where he learned all about farming thanks to his father who taught him to cultivate the land when he became an adult.

He now grows different varieties of yams which he sells at harvest time in the main plaza of the village where he lives.  He is able to earn enough income to support his children.

Arcadio is a hard-working, responsible man who is dedicated to his family and his work.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to improve his harvest and get a better market price so he can increase his income and continue putting food on the table.  He dreams of having a lot of cropland where he can offer employment and improve his economic stability to give his children an excellent education and better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies (fertilizers and fungicides).

loans.name: Mujeres Del Milenio Group

texts.es:
NANCY VILMA, tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos jóvenes. Ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres del Milenio" que está conformado por seis socias, todas caracterizadas por sus ansias de progreso y de hacer crecer sus negocios.
Nancy Vilma, se dedica desde hace quince años a la venta de salchipapas, sanguches, pollos broaster, y alternativamente caldo de gallina, que es muy requerido en época de invierno. Diariamente en horas de la noche inicia su trabajo para lo cual cuenta con un carrito sanguchero que ubica en la puerta de su casa, ya tiene clientes fijos y poco a poco aumenta también su clientela, le va bien en su negocio gracias a ello ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de suministros para la preparación de sus alimentos, para lo cual realizará sus compras en mayor cantidad para poder obtener menores precios.
texts.en: Nancy Vilma is 55 years old. She is married and has six young children. She belongs to the group 'Mujeres del Milenio' (Women of the Millenium), along with five other women, who all have a goal in common: they want to get ahead in life and to make their businesses grow. Nancy Vilma has been making and selling salchipapas (a fast-food dish made of fried sausages and chips served together with various sauces), sandwiches, fried chicken, and chicken soup (very much in demand in the winter) for fifteen years. She works every day and starts preparing the food before dawn. She sells the food from a sandwich cart located in front of her house. She has many regular customers and keeps getting new ones. Thanks to her business's success, she was able to support her children during their studies. Nancy will use the loan to buy ingredients and supplies to prepare the food she sells. She will buy these wholesale in order to have better prices.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her fast-food stall.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Fortaleza, está conformado por  8 integrantes, madres solteras responsables de 10 hijos. Son originarias del Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres de gustas disfrutar de tiempo de calidad con sus hijos, le prepara platillo típicos de la región como “Indio Viejo”  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, por lo tanto luchar día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La coordinadora del banco comunal es Aleyda y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, detergentes, jugos, tiste, cuajadas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciéndoles una su mercadería, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal mujeres de fortaleza agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países  pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres de Fortaleza” (Women of Strength) is comprised of 8 members, all single mothers with 10 minor children under their responsibility. They come from Malpaisillo which is located in the north of the country.    These people are known for being hard-working and responsible and very determined to improve their situation.  In their free time they enjoy spending quality time with their children and cooking a typical dish of "Indio Viejo".  Unfortunately, they were unable to get an education because they had to start work at a very young age to help with household expenses; so they struggle every day to give their children a better future.

The coordinator of the communal bank is Aleyda who runs a grocery store out of her home.  It is small store and she sells small quantities of rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, juices, soft drinks, custards and detergents.  She works some 12 hours a day and enjoys what she does.  The reason for the loan is to buy food products so she can improve her income in the near future.

The communal bank “Mujeres de Fortaleza” is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: To buy food products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, juices, soft drinks, custards and detergents.

loans.name: Hector Ernesto

texts.es:
Hector tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de la Tinguiña. Cada di se levanta muy temprano para poder trabajar como chofer de mototaxi, oficio con el cual puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos del hogar y poder sacer adelante a su familia, en especial por sus hijos que son muy pequeños. Cada día Hector trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y puede atender hasta 20 clientes al día; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable cuando conduce.

Hector esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, fierros, entre otros y  podrá seguir construyendo su vivienda de material noble,  lo cual le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida y brindar más seguridad a su familia, así el podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener una empresa de taxis”.
texts.en:
Hector, 35, lives in the city of Ica in the Tinguiña District.  Every day he gets up early to work as a motor-taxi driver, to earn enough income to cover household expenses and provide for his family, especially his small children.  Hector works around nine hours and attends to up to 20 customers a day.  He believes business is going well for him because he is very kind to customers and responsible when he drives.

Hector is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron and other supplies to continue building his house out of solid materials.  This will give him a better quality of life and more safety for his family, and allow him to continue striving to reach his goal of "Having a taxi company".

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario En "victoria San Lorenzo" Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario “En Victoria de san Lorenzo” esta dpuo esta integrado pora la señora Zoila Rosaura de 27 años, ella tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años y esta solicitando un crédito para poder invertir en la compra de cosmeticos y en la compra de ropa de vestir (pantalones para dama, blusas, calcetines, calcetas, playeras) ya que tiene una gran demanda por sus clientes y solicitan su apoyo ya que de esta forma ella podra vender mas variedad en productos de cosmeticos y como tambien en ropa, esta muy contenta ya que Kiva se a caracterisado por ayudar a las personas que nececitan salir adelante en su negocio y ella espera que le puedan ayudar desde ya les agradese su atencion prestada.
texts.en: One of the members of Dúo Solidario "En Victoria de San Lorenzo" Group is Zoila Rosaura, 27, who has four chidlren.  She has been earning a living for ten years selling cosmetics by catalogue.  The loan she is requesting is to buy cosmetics and clothing (women's pants, blouses, socks, knitwear, and beachwear) since there is much demand among her customers.  She is requesting your support so she can sell a wider variety of cosmetics and clothing.  Kiva is known for helping people get ahead in their businesses and she hopes to receive your support for which she is grateful.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 60 años de edad, pero su espíritu y su alegría es de una joven de 20 años, ya que ella nos comenta que la vejes se lleva solo por fuera porque si eres joven por dentro la edad queda de lado, ella es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que tiene un clima muy cálido y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, pallares, paprika, entre otros, se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, la cual es  muy visitada en todo el año por infinidad de turistas. A Rosa le gusta mucho su trabajo, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “Tallarines Verdes”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera Universitaria.

Día a día Rosa trabaja en su negocio de venta de Calzados puerta a puerta, ella trabaja por las mañanas y por las tardes y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y sobre todo a precios cómodos.

Rosa esta muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar zapatos y botas para ofrecer en su negocio ya que estamos en época de invierno y podrá tener más variedad de productos, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y sobre todo seguir adelante en búsqueda de cumplir su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Rosa, 60, has the spirit and cheerfulness of a 20-year-old and believes that being old is only seen on the outside because if you are young on the inside, age does not matter.  She is very enthusiastic and hard-working and lives in the city of Ica which has a warm climate and where agricultural activity is developed, especially growing of crops such as grapes, asparagus, paprika and others.  The Huacachina Lagoon is also there and visited all year around by many tourists.  Rosa enjoys her work but when she has free time she likes to make one of her favorite dishes:  "Tallarines Verdes" (green noodles).  Because of her scarce economic resources she was only able to get a fifth grade education but would have liked to go to the university.

Every day Rosa works in her business selling shoes door to door.  She works in the morning and afternoon and sees up to ten customers a day.  She believes business is going well because she sells quality products at comfortable prices.

Rosa is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time she receives their support.  On this occasion she plans to buy shoes and boots for the winter season.  This will giver her a wider variety of products so she can improve her income and quality of life.  This will allow her to continue working and striving to reach her goal of "Finishing construction of her own house".

loans.use: To buy winter shoes.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Abibatu. She is married and has three children, ages 8, 14 and 21. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help her brother with his children's schooling.  

In 2008, Abibatu established her provisions, drinks and toiletries business. She began her business to help her husband with running the affairs of their home. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are all ages and sexes. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Abibatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 to pay for additional drinks and provisions. She believes that this loan will help her increase her profits. In the future, Abibatu plans to expand her trade to the sale of recharge cards and hopes to be able to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Gabi

texts.en:
Gabi is a 55-year-old married father of two children. He owns a small garage where he has repaired cars and performed mechanical maintenance for the past 12 years. His wife is unemployed, meaning that he is the only financial provider of the family. 

Gabi is an ambitious person, and he wishes to expand his business by acquiring a loan that would allow him to purchase materials and a new work kit for his business. 

In the future, Gabi wishes to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and a new work kit for his business.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married with seven children, five of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her brother. She has a business raising chickens. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Teddy has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed. She works at home and sells on a wholesale basis only six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and poultry diseases. She generates additional income by selling scrap.   

Teddy aspires to own 2,000 chickens. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: Сухробджону 19 лет. Он успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Технологический Университет Таджикистана. Данное время он является студентом 1 курса. Он учится хорошо и отлично. Сухробджон любит все предметы, которые они учат в университете. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту. В будущем он мечтает стать высококвалифицированным специалистом и работать в престижной организации. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Suhrobjon is 19 years old. He successfully graduated from high school and was admitted into the Technological University of Tajikistan. He is currently a first-year student. He is learning exceptionally well. Suhrobjon loves all of the subjects that he studies in university. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. He needs to pay for his tuition, but he does not have the money.  He is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. In the future, he dreams of becoming a highly-qualified specialist in a prestigious organization. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition at university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing hair accessories, earrings, bracelets, and chains capacity.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr Sidikie

texts.en: This is thirty- three year-old Abu Bakarr.  He is married and has one child, aged four. In 2010, Abu Bakarr established his DVD, VCD, and recharging cards business. He began his business after dropping out of school to be self reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan of 3.000,000 SLL. Abu Bakarr requires a loan in order to pay for additional DVDs and recharge vouchers. He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and raise his profits. In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to improve his business and expand to the outskirts of town. He also hopes to be able to further his education and attain a degree. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for DVDs and recharge vouchers.

loans.name: Carmen Ventura

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene seis hijos vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y tiene una pequeñas piscina de truchas (peces) Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades para los cultivos y para los peces comprar balanceado, lombrices que es el alimento.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es tener dienro para construir la casa ya que viven en casa arrendada, en los tiempos libres le gusta ver television y cocinar los domigos platosd tipicos para la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 39 years old and in a common law marriage. She has six children and lives with her spouse and children in Recinto Terrenal, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton, Los Ríos province. 

She belongs to the TERRENAL communal bank, located in the recinto TERRENAL, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. It is dedicated to farming and livestock work.  

Carmen works in farming. She grows corn and has a small trout pool. With the loan, she will be able to buy materials such as fertilizer and insecticides to avoid pests and disease for the crops. For the fish, she will buy balanced feed and worms, which are their food. She makes her purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo. 

Her dream is to have money to build a house, since they rent. In her free time, she likes to watch television and cook traditional dishes on Sundays for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, insecticides, balanced fish feed, and earthworms.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is 23 years old, he lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who works in the ministry of defense getting a low salary that is not enough to cover household expenses. He faces a big challenge of not being able to buy household improvements. He intends to buy supplies for his house, so he has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy a fridge and washing machine for his house.

Abdu hopes to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and washing machine for his house.

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en: Dezi is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (older parents). She owns a restaurant and has been in this business for many years. She generates additional income through selling piped water and having a food stall. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. Dezi has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, onions, beef, chicken and ground nuts. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, onions, beef, chicken and ground nuts.

loans.name: La Gota * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LA GOTA * 26,  Está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes todas mujeres la presidenta del banco es la Sra.   Maria tiene 33 años y 4 hijos de las edades de 2, 4, 7 y 12  años, todos se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la venta y fabricación de artesanías de macramé para decoración del hogar, todo el trabajo lo realiza de manera, ella tiene su  taller  que se encuentra en la zona de Achachicala,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.   Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra materiales de construcción para refacción de su vivienda,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando su casa, la Sra.   Maria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de artesanía grande y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela,  la Sra.   Maria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: The LA GOTA * 26 communal bank is made up of eight members, all of them women. The president of the bank is Maria. She is 33 and has 4 children, aged  2, 4, 7 and 12. All of them are school aged. She makes and sells macrame items for home decor. She does all the work and has her workshop in the Achachicala area. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Maria is going to use this loan to buy construction materials to do home repair. Her reason for asking for the loan is to continue improving her home. Maria is going to use her profits to keep buying materials and thus improve her income.  She wants her business to have a big artisanal crafts store and thus offer a better service to her customers. Maria is a very hardworking person who is happy with this opportunity being offered.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home repair.

loans.name: Confidence

texts.fr: Confidence est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est célibataire. Il fait le commerce de friperie depuis 2009. Il vend à tout le monde dans un marché de la place. Il achète ses produits au Port autonome de Lomé. Confidence a requis son troisième crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des bals des friperies. Dans les prochaines années, Confidence voudrait construire sa propre boutique et exploiter convenablement son activité.
texts.en:
Confidence, age 32, is single. He's been selling secondhand clothing since 2009. He sells his products to the general public in a market of the city. 

He gets his supplies at the Autonomous Port of Lomé. Confidence is seeking his third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy bales of used clothes.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to build his own store and run his business well.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse de cuvettes, mr Kossi est père de famille. Il revend au marché depuis 1997 des chaussures. Son premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter des marchandises afin d’aider sa famille et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi is the father of a family and he is married to a reseller of plastic basins. Since 1997, he's been selling shoes at the market.

His first loan will enable him to buy shoes in order to help his family and make his business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Shaken

texts.ru: Шакен 63 года, вдова, дети Шакен уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Шакен имеет среднее образование, по характеру, спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Шакен в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Шакен в хозяйстве имеется: 5 дойных коров, 3 теленка, 15 овец, а также имеет земельный надел в размере 1,72 ГА, на которой выращивает клевер. Ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции, яиц и кур, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Дополнительным доходом считаются денежные переводы с России, где на заработках у Шакен находится сын и сноха. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Шакен женить своих детей и обустроить их. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шакен обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. Доходы от кредита Шакен планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Shaken is 63 years old and a widow. Her children are all grown up and self-sufficient. Shaken has a secondary education. She is composed, level-headed and hard working by nature. For the primary source of income for her family, Shaken has practiced animal husbandry for many years now, starting her business with 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Shaken has on her farm: 5 milk cows, 3 calves, 15 sheep, and also has a 1.72 hectare plot of land on which she grows clover. Her business brings in about 20,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk, dairy products, eggs, and chickens, which serves to cover the cost of food and daily living needs for her family. Remittances from Russia, where Shaken's son and  daughter-in-law earn a living, serve as additional income. The profits from Shaken's agricultural business allowed her to marry off her children and help them start their households. For the purpose of the further development of her business, Shaken turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls and sheep. Shaken plans to invest the earnings from this loan in the further expansion of her farm and she would also like to repair her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy bulls and sheep

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали житель города Дангара. Ему  42 года. Он женат и имеет детей. С 2009 года Шерали занимается животноводческим бизнесом. Он закупает, откармливает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот мясной породы. Его бизнес приносит ему стабильный доход и ему нравится его работа. У Шерали хороший опыт в разведении скота, так как в детстве вместе с отцом он разводил скот и теперь продолжает ремесло своего отца. Шерали сейчас хочет увеличить поголовье скота для развития бизнеса. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа двух голов бычков.
texts.en: Sherali lives in the city of Dangara. He is 42 years old. He is married and has children. Since 2009, Sherali has practiced animal husbandry. He buys, fattens up and then resells beef cattle. He business brings in a steady income and he likes his work. Sherali has a lot of experience in raising cattle, as in his childhood he and his father raised cattle and now he continues his father's trade. Sherali now wants to expand his stock of cattle for the development of his business. He is requesting a loan to buy two bulls.

loans.use: to buy two bulls to expand his stock of cattle

loans.name: Sarantañani Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SARANTAÑANI,  Está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes todas mujeres la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Sonia  tiene 27 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 6 y 10 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Alpacoma,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Sonia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en: The Sarantañani Communal Bank is comprised of eight members, all women.  Sonia is the bank’s president. She is 27 years old, and married with two children, ages six and ten.  She sells basic necessities in her neighborhood store located in the Alpacoma area.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  She is going to use the loan to stock her business with merchandise such as groceries, sweets, and soft drinks.  She is requesting this loan because she has high demand and that is where sales increase, so she needs to stock her merchandise.  Sonia faces the challenge of competition in her business as there are several stores in the area.  She is going to use the funds to purchase more merchandise to stock her store and continue growing more each day.  Her desire for her business is to continue making sales and to have a stocked shop.  In this way, she will be able to grow her business, improve her income, and therefore, improve the quality of life for herself and her family.  She feels grateful for the opportunity offered to her and her group partners

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (canned food, consumer products).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Juan vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil concubino, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura siembra en terreno de 13 Has herencia de sus padres y terreno propio produce papa y papaliza con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 3 de engorde y 2 lecheras. Sr Juan requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico 20 cubos, requiere el fertilizante orgánico para la siembra en esta época de julio a agosto ya que este año tiene pensado incrementar mas su producción agrícola, además quiere aprovechar esta época porque los precios son bajos. Por último Juan se sintió contento al tener la oportunidad de acceder al crédito, además de poder contar con la ayuda de la institución porque con la compra de abono orgánico ya tiene asegurado la siembra de papa y otros productos para la seguridad alimentaria y generar mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en: Juan lives in the community of Colomi. He is 34 years old. His marital status is co-habitating. Economically he is independent. He is dedicated to farming, planting 13 hectares of land inherited from his parents and his own land produces potato and ulloco by rotating crops and with experience in his field. He also has heads of cattle: three for fattening and two dairy. Juan requires the loan to buy 20 cubes of organic fertilizer. He needs the organic fertilizer to plant in this season of July and August since this year he's thinking of increasing his agricultural production more. Also, he wants to take advantage of this season because the prices are low. Ultimately, Juan feels content to have the opportunity to access the loan as well as to be able to count on the help of the institution because with the purchase of organic fertilizer he will assure the potato planting and other products for the food security and to generate better income in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en: Mazen is a 37-year-old married father with two children. He works as a house painter on construction sites. His wife is unemployed, meaning that he has to provide the financial resources for the whole family. However, Mazen wishes to start a new business fixing motorbikes. Thus, Mazen needed the support of Al Majmoua, which is why he decided to request a loan and purchase a work kit that will allow him to launch his business. Hopefully, Al Majmoua will be supporting Mazen every step of the way. In the future, he wishes to further expand his business and start selling motorbikes.

loans.use: to start a new business fixing motorbikes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
After successfully graduating senior high school, Elizabeth is now an established businesswoman. She sells groceries in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. 

Elizabeth is single. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for her parents and other siblings. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of sugar, candies, milo, eggs, tissues, toilet roll and washing detergents, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sugar, candies, milo, eggs, tissues, toilet rolls and washing detergents.

loans.name: Kinepna Group

texts.en:
To be a successful business woman, one needs to be healthy and strong. Unfortunately Hoikholhing’s health deteriorates after frequent traveling in different places or villages to sell used clothes. Her chest pain troubles her if she does hard labour. 

Hoikholhing is the group representative as a featured borrower. She is on the extreme left in the picture with hand raised. She belongs to “Kinepna Group,” which means hope in their language. They called themselves “Hope Group” because they believe that everything that is done in the world is done by hope. With that concept in mind, the group is determined to work hopefully.

Hoikholhing used to sell used clothes in the village and neighbouring villages. She also sold them in the nearest town market, which is about 8 kms away from the village. She used to purchase used clothes from the city market and sell them. The profit was sufficient to manage daily expenses with a monthly savings. She started feeling chest pain after frequently traveling to make sales. She quit her used clothes selling business and decided to start a poultry business to generate income.

With the Kiva loan, Hoikholhing is planning to purchase 50 to 60 chicks in different breeds, raise them and sell them when they are fully grown. She will vaccinate and raise them with nutritional chicken feeds. There are women market vendors who sell poultry in the town market and in the city market. She will supply the poultry sellers from home without traveling distances. That way her health will be improved and subsequently she will generate income for the family. 

She thanked Kiva and WSDS for this opportunity and says the essential, most requisite -- i.e. capital money -- will be provided by the esteemed Kiva via WSDS. God bless Kiva and WSDS.

The rest of the group members are engaged in growing chives. They usually sell them in the town market and in the main city market.

loans.use: To purchase 50 to 60 chicks, raise them and sell them for profits when fully grown.

loans.name: Mawunyo

texts.en:
Mawunyo is married and has two children. She has received schooling to the end of junior high school. 

Currently, Mawunyo sells grains in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this industry for about two years now. Her husband is a farmer. Mawunyo’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Mawunyo will use the loan to increase her existing maize, beans, and rice capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Mawunyo plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing maize, beans, and rice capacity.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is street vendor who sells food ingredients in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). He has had some formal education, as he is a junior high school graduate. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is also a street vendor. Charles has been selling these items for close to 3 years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of biscuits, candies, bags of sugar, and rice, thus allowing him to meet rising customers’ demands. He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to fulfill his dream of buying a stand, allowing him sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of biscuits, candies, bags of sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Chullou Lom Group

texts.en:
“We flea-market vendors are frozen mid-haggle and middle-aged women who are frozen in the middle of our lives,” quotes Neikhol. 

She has sold vegetables in the town market shed for more than ten years. The inability to continue studies during childhood days and poor financial conditions of the family is still taking its toil. It left Neikhol with very few options to generate income for the family. 

Neikhol is the featured borrower member for "Chullou Lom" Group. She is pictured on the extreme left with hand raised. All group members reside in a village that is about 40 kms on the southern side of the state in Manipur. Manipur is one the northeastern states of India.
 
Neikhol grows chives as her main produce in the fields. Chives grow fast and they are ready to be sold in three months. Chives are easy to sell as they can be prepared in various ways. She also sells other fresh vegetables in accordance with the season and the demands. She sells mustard, pumpkins, bean sprouts, bay leaves, lady's finger, pea-shoots, yams, etc. She gets the vegetables from the fields at dawn, goes to the town market, and spends her whole day selling vegetables. Since the market is on the main National Highway, she manages to sell all her hoardings for a day. Customers throng in from all the nearby villages, and travelers and passersby also drop in to purchase vegetables. 

The town market is popularly known for reasonable rates and quality. Neikhol says she is lucky to have a place in the town market because this market is the main reason why she is able to supplement and manage the family expenses. 

The unavailability of capital money paralyses most of her ideas and plans to make a better livelihood  But she says she wanted to generate income by selling pigs, and she used her savings to purchase those piglets and she raises them at the back of her house.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase seeds and saplings of Rabi crops to grow. (Rabi crops are sewn in winter and harvested in spring.) She will purchase saplings of cabbage, cauliflower, broad beans, peas and pea-shoots, garlic, onions, spring onions, chives, broccoli and more.

She says she will continue growing vegetables and selling them for profits. She will take rest only when her children can take care of the family affairs. She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the absolute financial assistance for an underserved vendor like her, which paves the way for her to continue and promote better means to generate income. She asks Kiva to continue helping her in the future and also says, “Kiva work is very motivational and inspirational. Thank you, Kiva."

The rest of the group members are also engaged in growing chives and selling them in the town market.

loans.use: To purchase more Rabi crops to grow and sell  for profits.

loans.name: Denys Alberto

texts.es:
Denys tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual tiene un clima cálido y acogedor. Denys trabaja día a día como carpintero, y con el fruto de su pequeño negocio puede solventar los gastos de su familia y poder día a día salir adelante, para ello Denys trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes ya que hace reparaciones de madera, confección de sillas, mesas, entre otros. Denys cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y es cumplido con los trabajos que le encomiendan.

Denys está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su taller de carpintería”.
texts.en:
Denys is 38 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, which has a warm and welcoming climate. Denys works day after day as a carpenter and, with the fruit of his small busyess, he is able to pay the family bills and be able to get ahead daily. For this, Denys works around 9 hours a day and can tend to up to 10 customers since he makes wood repairs, makes chairs, tables, among others. Denys believes he is getting ahead because he is very friendly with the customers and he is satisfied with the work they entrust to him.

Denys is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy construction materials to be able to make improvements to his home. In this way, he will have a better quality of life and he will continue working hard to be able to realize his greatest dream: To have a carpenter shop.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
After graduating vocational school, Stella decided to sell soft drinks and frozen fish in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). With over five years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

This loan will be used to help her purchase more soft drinks and fish for resale. 

She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who does carpentry) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more soft drinks and fish for resale.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is single and has two children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Louis is now an established businesswoman who operates a fufu chop bar in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). 

Fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou) is a paste made from starchy root vegetables put into a mortar and beaten smooth with a pestle until the desired consistency is reached. The malleable dough is served and eaten with a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, palm oil fruit soup or other soups. She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Louis uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Louis will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantain, chicken and bush meat, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Louis plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantain, chicken and bush meat.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina sells doughnuts in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been educated to the end of vocational school.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Georgina has been working in this enterprise for nine years now. As the sole provider in the family, she is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current ingredient levels. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her bakery and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current ingredient levels enabling her to make more tasty doughnuts.

loans.name: Ayirebi

texts.en:
Ayirebi is single and has three children. After successfully graduating middle school, she is now an established businesswoman, selling jewelry, silver pots, and secondhand clothes in Ve-Golokwati, near Hohoe. Ayirebi has been actively involved in her business for about 13 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ayirebi is requesting a loan to purchase increased amounts of jewelry, silver pots, and secondhand clothing to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ayirebi plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry, silver pots, and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is married with three children. He has received some schooling till the end of middle school. Currently, Anthony sells meat and prepares kebabs in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). He has been involved in this industry for about 11 years now. His wife is a petty trader. Anthony’s income goes toward helping his wife pay for the family's general expenses. 

Anthony will use the loan to increase his existing meat supply. With the new profits from his expanded enterprise, Anthony plans to develop his business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase his existing meat supply.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married with two children. He has received some schooling till the end of senior high school. Currently, Simon is a driver in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). He has been involved in this industry for about four years now. His wife is a petty trader. Simon’s income goes toward helping his wife pay for the family's general expenses. 

Simon will use the loan to work on his damaged car. With the new profits from his expanded enterprise, Simon plans to develop his business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to work on his damaged car.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more a year now. Agapita sells various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Agapita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, eggs and cooking ingredients, among others. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Agapita has hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, eggs and cooking ingredients, among others.

loans.name: Genivive

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Genivive learned how to sew and decided to set up her own sewing center in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). 

With over three years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funding. 

This loan will be used to help her purchase more zippers, thread, and linen for her sewing center and cloth for resale to her customers. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more zippers, thread, and linen.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with three children. She has received some schooling till the end of junior high school. Currently, Mary sells plastic bowls and containers in Ve-Golokwati, near Hohoe. She has been involved in this industry for about three years and her husband is a peasant farmer. Mary’s income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Mary is requesting a loan to increase her existing plasticware capacity. With the profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to buy plasticware

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther operates a "banku" selling business (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste). She prepares the "banku" on her own and subsequently sells it in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe).  

Esther is a divorcee with three children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esther uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Esther will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall "banku" sales. Having a middle level education, Esther understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall "banku" sales.

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en:
Fedelia is married to a farmer. She has eight children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a junior high school graduate, Fedelia currently sells fried yam and sweet potatoes in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). With over eight years of experience in this trade, Fedelia sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. 

Thus, her loan will be used to buy larger quantities of yam and sweet potatoes, gallons of oil and firewood, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Fedelia wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her petty trading enterprise.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of yam and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from Lila, Bohol. Emma has been engaged in hog raising business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Emma is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty "wakye" (a rice and beans dish).

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Even though Fati grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Fati is an entrepreneur. She cooks and sells rice in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe).  Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. 

She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Fati has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more bags of rice. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice.

loans.name: Ahshi Shg Group

texts.en:
“I am a farmer and I do not have other means to generate income, if I do not use farming in the best possible way,” says Lhingkhonei. 

She and other seven other members joined hands together and formed the "Ahshi Group." Their main motive is to encourage one another and assist both morally and financially in times of need. All the group members are engaged in their own respective businesses to make a living for their families and themselves. Lhingkhonei is the group representatives and she is the featured member, pictured with her hand raised. She is married with one child and her husband works in the construction sites projected by the state government.

Lhingkhonei used to weave and also used to collect firewood to sell. But her business failed after the Village Authority put a ban on collection of firewood in the forest. She had no other means but go back to where she started and that was farming. 

The presence of the town market on the main National Highway is a great advantage for businessmen and women. She has been selling fresh vegetables in the said town market for more than three years. She grows vegetables in the field and also plants vegetables at the back of her house. She gets the vegetable supplies from other villagers and also supplements them with the vegetables from her field and sells them. But the income generated from selling vegetables is not sufficient to manage the daily expenses and also to save. 

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase various vegetable seeds and saplings. If possible, she will also purchase vegetable fertilizers for better growth and production. She will grow them in the field and when they are ready to be sold, she will sell them. She believes that after availing the loan from Kiva, she will be able to sell only her field products and not be dependent on the other vegetable producers.

Her gratitude is immeasurable and she wishes to continue keeping the relationship strong. Her aspiration is to own the largest vegetable field in the village and become the largest producer in the whole area. 

The rest of the group members are engaged in growing and selling chives.

loans.use: To purchase yam, chive and ginger saplings to grow and sell for profit.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 51 años de edad, es acompañado y tiene tres hijos pero no viven con él. Es una persona que toda su vida se ha dedicado a lo que es el trabajo de la pesca artesanal actividad que aprendió de sus familiares, el lugar en donde vive la principal actividad es la pesca artesanal y es la principal  fuente de ingresos de los pobladores de la zona. 

Todo lo que respecta a los insumos para la pesca las personas de la localidad los compran en la ciudad, en vista que los pueden comprar a precios accesibles y además se encuentra una gran variedad de los mismos. Lo que mas compra el señor es lo relacionado con las redes que utilizan para pescar.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para la reparación de un motor fuera de borda, el cual utiliza para la pesca artesanal, el motor necesita lo que es un pequeño ajuste para hacerlos trabajar.

Al tener en buenas condiciones su equipo y aperos de pesca, podrá trabajar con toda normalidad y obtener ingresos al comercializar el producto que extrae del mar y con esos ingresos cubrir las necesidades el hogar, como salud, alimentación, vestuario, etc. Además, junto a su compañera de vida podrán comprar el derecho de la casa donde viven y con ello se aseguraran tener su propia casa, él manifestó que ya con su equipo arreglado su meta será trabajar duro para salir adelante.

Su sueño es comprar un equipo más para obtener el doble de ingresos y darle todo lo suficiente a su compañera de vida para tener una vida sin pasar necesidades.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 51 years old and is married with 3 children who do not live with him. He is someone who has spent all of his life doing traditional fishing, a skill which he learnt from members of his family. Where he lives, fishing is the main line of work and is the main source of income for people in the area. The local people buy all of the supplies they need for fishing in the city, since they can find a wide range there and buy them at affordable prices. Most of Gregorio's purchases are to do with the nets which he uses for fishing.

The loan Gregorio is asking Fundación Campo for is to repair an outboard motor which he uses for traditional fishing. The motor needs a small adjustment to make it work.

With his fishing tools and equipment in good condition he will be able to get back to normal work and earn money selling the fish he gets from the sea. With this income he can cover the household necessities such as health costs, food, clothing etc. In addition he and his life partner will be able to buy the rights to the house they live in and so be able to have their own house. He says that when his equipment is mended his goal will be to work hard to make progress in life.

His dream is to buy more equipment so he can double his income and provide sufficiently for his wife so that she has everything she needs in life.

loans.use: to repair an outboard motor which he uses for traditional fishing. The motor needs a small adjustment to make it work.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 32-year-old single man living in a village in the Bekaa valley of Lebanon. He is responsible for the living of three members of his family. 

He has worked as a house painter on construction sites for 15 years. 

He decided to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua in order to seek support for his future career plan. He needs the loan in order to purchase materials that would enhance the quality of his work. In the future, Kamal wishes to take on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase materials that would enhance the quality of his work.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins sells electrical items in Ve-Golokwati, near Hohoe. His earnings are generally used to help his wife, who is a petty trader, support their one child. Collins has been involved in selling electrical wares for eight years now. 

Collins is requesting a loan to purchase additional amounts of electrical wires, bulbs, and sockets to increase his inventory capacity. He aspires to use the profit from his loan to both better market his business and increase his existing working capital. Collins hopes that this strategy will allow him to expand his present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase electrical wires, bulbs, and sockets

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn earns a living through her hog-raising business. She is a married woman and has five grown-up children. Evelyn lives with her family in the town of Lila, Bohol. Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria fries and sells doughnuts in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been educated until junior high school.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a pastor. 

Gloria has been working in this enterprise for four years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels buying bags of flour, oil and sugar. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her doughnut enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Mawuko

texts.en:
Mawuko is married with three children. He has received some schooling till the end of middle school. Currently, Mawuko rents out plastic chairs and canopies in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). He has been involved in this industry for about eight years now. His wife is a petty trader. Mawuko’s income goes toward helping his wife pay for the family's general expenses. 

Mawuko will use the loan to increase his existing plastic chair supply. With the new profits from his expanded enterprise, Mawuko plans to develop his business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase his existing plastic chairs supply.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than three years now. She lives with her family in the town of Panglao, Bohol. Lucia is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna runs a small and beautiful farm which currently includes 50 chickens, a pig, and a plot of arable land where she cultivates haricot, pepper and apricot, peach, plum, and nut trees. She takes care of her three children and her mother-in-law. Anna's husband is now seeking a job in neighboring country, so farming is the only source of income for this family. Despite her many difficulties, Anna takes care of her farm with love and pleasure. She sells her harvest locally and uses her income for her children's living expenses.

Anna is requesting a loan to purchase three oxen and increase her farming activities. She is a hardworking woman who waits for your support and hopes that her loan will be a good start toward making her farm profitable and big.

loans.use: to buy three oxen

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 26-year-old man living in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a father of one child. Abdullah runs a grocery store and small mill (Tahoun) that he started eight years ago with limited capital and income. By sticking with his business, which is the main source for feeding his family, he has been able to attract new clients which has helped to expand his business capital and income. Abdullah is happy for the increase in clients but, on the other hand, he faces the financial challenge of meeting their needs.

Abdullah is requesting a 200,000 YER loan from Al Amal Bank to purchase groceries and mill inputs such as wheat. In the future, he hopes to expand his businesses.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and wheat

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Femme de 45ans, Abra vit avec son seul enfant de 13ans à Lomé. En 2008, elle a démarré la vente des produits de premières nécessités (riz, huile végétale, sucre…) dans une boutique. N’arrivant plus à satisfaire les demandes clients, elle fait sa première demande à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle espère agrandir son activité et supporter les désirs de son enfant.
texts.en: Abra, a 45 year old woman, lives on her own with her 13 year old child in Lomé. In 2008, she began selling staple food products (rice, vegetable oil, sugar) from a small boutique. Unable to completely satisfy the demands of her clientele, she is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to stock up on merchandise. She hopes to expand her activity and take care of the needs and wants of her child.

loans.use: Purchase staple food products

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 21-year-old single man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a grocery store, which is his main source of income. He started his business with limited capital that his dad provided him. His dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB to stock his business with more products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store with more products

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Acuarius Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario Acuarius, este dúo esta integrado por la señora Ledy quien tiene 45 años de edad ella actual mente tiene una estetica de belleza la cual dia con dia obtiene la bendicion de Dios para poder atender y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes esta muy contenta porque los creditos que le han otorgado le a ayudado en gran bendicion ya que solo de esa forma ella a logrado surtir mas su estetica de bellesa ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en cosmeticos para su estetica su sueño mas adelante es compra otra bitrina para poder exibir un poco mas su mercaderia esperando que ustedes la sigan apoyando en los creditos y desde ya les agradese su ayuda y que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
Ledy who is 45 years old is a member of the Solidario Acuarius duo. Currently she has a beauty salon and with God's blessings she is able to attend to her customers and provide them with a good service on a daily basis. She is very happy because the loans have been a great blessing and a help to her, since it is only through the loans that she has been able to to stock the beauty salon better. 

She is asking for this loan to buy more cosmetics for the salon. Her dream for the future is to buy another display cabinet so that she can display her merchandise better. She is hoping you will continue helping her with the loans and thanks you in advance for your help and hopes God will bless you.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a small-scale cloth seller in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has had some formal education as she is a middle school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a petty trader/farmer. Georgina has been working as a petty trader for close to 10 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

Georgina plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of varieties of cloth, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a cloth stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of varieties of cloth

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is single and has six children. After successfully graduating middle school, Kate is now an established businesswoman. She sells bananas and other fruit in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Kate uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Kate will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bananas from the local farmers, as well as paddy rice, and oranges, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kate plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bananas, paddy rice, and oranges from the local farmers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more linen, zippers, and thread for his sewing business

loans.name: Adolph

texts.en:
Adolph is married with three children. He has received some schooling--until the end of middle school. Currently, Adolph sells phone credit cards in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). He has been involved in this industry for about six years now. His wife is a petty trader. 

Adolph’s income goes towards helping his wife pay for the family's general expenses. Adolph will use the loan to increase his existing phone credit card capacity. With the new profits from his expanded enterprise, Adolph plans to develop his business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase his existing phone credit card capacity

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des cartes de recharges, mr Komla sollicite un second crédit pour satisfaire ses besoins. Âgé de 35ans, il n’a pas d’enfant en charge.
