A l’avenir, il espère acheter des cartes de recharges supplémentaires et assurer la scolarité de ses frères. Mr Komla a démarré l’activité en 2011.
texts.en: In order to purchase additional phone recharge cards in order to satisfy his clientele, Mr Komla is asking for a second loan. He is 35 years old, without any children under his responsibility. In the future, he hopes to purchase additional phone recharge cards and ensure the education of his brothers. Mr Komla began his commercial activity in 2011.

loans.use: Purchase refill cards and candy

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. He has two children and has been doing farming work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "It's a source of income for his family's needs." His biggest challenges are: "Lack of market, poor roads." Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Geoffrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "It's customer-friendly."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "Interest rates are customer-friendly."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked: "How will this loan benefit his family?," Geoffrey replied: "It will improve our livelihood."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Geoffrey owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and motorcycle,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, and DVD,' but does not have: 'electricity, running water, or a sewing machine.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Narcesa

texts.en:
Narcesa runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Narcesa is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. Narcesa dreams of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Fuerte De Lanco Group

texts.es: Magaly quien está ubicada a un costado derecho de la foto con un turbante color naranjo,  es socia del Banco Comunal Fuerte de Lanco, ubicado en Valdivia Región de Los Ríos. En este Banco Comunal los socios tienen venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de empanadas cyber, local de comidas al paso, bordados a máquina; y el negocio de Magaly es venta y producción de pasteles tortas y además ofrece coffees a empresas, eventos y produce mermeladas y conservas. Comenzó su negocio formal hace 5 años aproximadamente y hace 11 años informal. Aprendió la pastelería gracias a su madre, por lo cual con el tiempo ella se fue especializando. El problema que ha tenido con su negocio es no poder con un capital para sostenerlo. Con el crédito que está solicitando ella compraría cremas para tortas y pasteles, huevos,maicena, azúcar, duraznos y piñas. Espera que le vaya muy bien, ya que tiene mucha gente que siempre esta solicitándole tortas y pasteles. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que se encontró con un grupo de personas muy bueno.
texts.en:
Magaly, who is seen on the right of the photo in an orange turban, is a member of the Fuerte de Lanco communal bank, situated in Valdivia, Region de los Ríos. In this communal bank the members have various businesses such as selling new and second hand clothing, selling empanadas/cyber café, takeaway food shop and machine embroidery.

Magaly's business is the production and sale of cakes and pastries and she also offers coffee to businesses and events and makes jams and conserves. She began her business formally 5 years ago and informally 11 years ago. She learnt patisserie from her mother and over time this became her speciality. 

The problem she has had with her business is not having any capital to maintain it. She would use the loan she is asking for to buy cream for cakes and pastries, eggs, cornflour, sugar, peaches and pineapples. She expects it to go well as she already has many people who are always asking her for cakes and pastries.

What she has liked most about working with Fondo Esperanza is that she has met a very good group of people.

loans.use: to buy cream, peaches, pineapples, eggs, cornflour and sugar.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in the city of Kapan, in Syunik region. He is a successful businessman and a very lovely father for his family. He has three beautiful daughters and a nice wife who does not work and takes care of their smallest daughter. 

Samvel has his own businesses. He gives taxi services, transporting people in his own car. He also has a small stall of his own, where he gives document services and other paper copying. 

People trust Samvel very much and they say that he is a very honest businessman and a very attentive and careful driver. Three years ago, he changed his old car and bought a new, more comfortable, safe, and modern one for his passengers. 

Samvel asks for a loan from Kiva lenders because he needs to buy new tires for his car and a new copy machine. This loan will give him a chance to work faster and be more productive.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi and a new copy machine for his document business.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, con su conyugue, con la cual todavía no tiene hijos. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la elaboración de bolsas plásticas que comercializa en las tiendas de diferentes barrios de Barranquilla, en el mercado del centro de la ciudad, tiendas del municipio de Soledad, y de Sabanagrande. Sus ventas son a crédito, compra de contado el material con el que elabora las bolsas; el material es polietileno. Desde hace seis (6) años inició el negocio personalmente, pero desde hace trece (13) años lo aprendió con su papá, es decir a la edad de diez (10) años, empezó a ayudar a su padre, en la fabricación de las bolsas y a repartirlas en las tiendas y negocios que se las solicitaban. Cuando su papá entró en una edad avanzada, le dejó a él completamente el negocio. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra del material polietileno para la elaboración de las bolsas plásticas. Espera comprar a bajos costos para dar mejores precios a sus clientes y mantenerlos fieles a su negocio. Tiene también como metas futuras: Adquirir otras máquinas para mejorar su infraestructura; comprar una casa propia para cuando tenga sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en: Juan is twenty-three and lives in the city of Barranquilla in the department of Atlántico with his wife.  They do not have children yet.  His business involves making plastic bags which he sells at stores in different neighborhoods in Barranquilla, at the city's central market, and at stores in the towns of Soledad and Sabanagrande.   He buys the polyethylene he uses to make the bags in cash and sells the bags on credit.  He went out on his own six years ago, but learned the business thirteen years ago, when he was ten, from his father.  He started out helping his father make bags and distribute them to stores and businesses that asked for them.  When his father reached an advanced age, he gave the entire business to Juan.  This is Juan's first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he'll use it to buy polyethylene for making the plastic bags.  He hopes to buy at lower prices so he can offer better prices to his customers and keep them loyal to his business.  He also has some future goals: to get better machines to improve infrastructure; and to buy his own house so when he has children they can live better.

loans.use: to buy polyethylene for making plastic bags.

loans.name: Maria Mafaldina

texts.es:
Doña María Mafaldina es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada y con una familia muy numerosa la cual está compuesta por 10 hijos con un grado de educación primaria no completada. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo actividad inculcada por sus padres ya que es una tradición familiar y su único medio de ingreso económico. Ella se especializa en el cultivo de papa pero en tiempos de invierno también siembra maíz y frijol. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios de la zona y la tierra que en compañía de sus hijos y su esposo trabajan es propia. 

Ella actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla certificada de papa, abono y foliares para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de papa ya que de esa manera ella podrá proteger y fortalecer su plantación.

sus planes a futuro son los de cultivar una mayor cantidad y variedad de producto ya que así ella podrá ofrecer a sus clientes mas y podrá percibir mejores ingresos para poder apoyar a sus hijos en lo que ellos necesiten en cuanto estudio, vestimenta, medicinas, etc.
texts.en:
Doña María Mafaldina is 48 years old, married, and with a very large family which is made up of 10 children that have not completed primary school. She is in agriculture for a living, long instilled by her parents as it is a family tradition and her only means of income. She specializes in the cultivation of potatoes but in the winter time she also plants corn and beans. Her customers are the different brokers of the area. The land that she works with her children and husband is their own.

Today she is requesting help in order to buy certified potato seed, fertilizer and leaves to do maintenance on her potato crops so that she will be able to protect and fortify her farm.

Her future plans are cultivating a larger quantity and variety of products so that she will be able to offer her customers more, and earn better income to support her children in what they need in terms of study, clothing, medicines, etc.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seed and supplies for their crops

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y es madre de tres hijos. Es una persona humilde y trabajadora que además de cuidar a sus hijos se dedica a confeccionar ropa y uniformes para los estudiantes. Aprendió su oficio ya que le brindaron la oportunidad en un taller de corte y confección  y desde entonces dedico su tiempo y empeño por hacer las cosas mejor cada día y así ha logrado superar muchas limitantes que se le han presentado. 

Ella adquiere los materiales para confeccionar la ropa es la capital del país y  en otros lugares donde encuentra accesorios como hilos, tijeras, botones etc. Ella tiene que hacer un largo recorrido para poder obtener sus materiales y poder solventar las necesidades de sus clientes y las necesidades de su familia. 
Para trabajar con uniformes escolares le dan todos los materiales y solo le pagan la mano de obra por la confección.
 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales como telas, botones, hilos, tijeras, etc., y para dar mantenimiento a sus maquinas que tienen unos detalles que reparar.

De esta manera será satisfecha la necesidad de tener las maquinas en las mejores condiciones y tener todos los materiales necesarios para la confección de nuevos uniformes así como también ropa de vestir para caballero, faldas y blusas para señorita y ropa para niños. El cliente podrá confeccionar ropa sin estar con temor de que se le pueda arruinar terminantemente sus maquinas y además sin preocupación que no podrá terminar las confecciones por no tener lo necesario.

Confeccionara ropa en mejores condiciones ya que no le ara falta nada y sus maquinas estarán en buenas condiciones para trabajar y de esta manera podrá generar mejores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
María is thirty-nine years old, is married, and is the mother of three children.  She is a very humble and hardworking person.  In addition to taking care of her children, she makes a living sewing clothing and uniforms for students.  She learned this trade at a sewing workshop and training center that offered her this opportunity.  Since then, she has dedicated her time and efforts towards making better products every day.  She has been able to overcome many obstacles.

She acquires the materials for making clothing in her country's capital and in other areas where she can find items like thread, scissors, buttons, etc.  She has to make a long journey in order to obtain these materials and to be able to meet the needs of her customers and of her family.  When she makes school uniforms, she is given all of the materials and customers only pay her to actually make the clothing.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy materials like fabric, buttons, thread, scissors, etc. and to provide some maintenance to the machines she has that are in need of repair.  
 
In doing this, she will satisfy her need of having the machines in the best condition possible.  She will have all of the necessary materials to make new uniforms, clothing for men, skirts and blouses for ladies, and clothing for children.  She will be able to make clothing without being afraid of ruining her machines and without worrying about not finishing her clothing due to lack of materials.

She will create her clothing items in the best conditions, since she will not be in need of anything and her machines will be in good working condition.  In this way, she will be able to generate more income in order to cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, buttons, thread, scissors, etc. and to provide maintenance to those machines that are in need of some repairs.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 22 years old. He lives in the city of Sevan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his parents, sister, and brother, who, now, is passing his military service. 

Ara’s father is a very skilled hairdresser in their city and, today, Ara also has become like his father, a skilled and well-known hairdresser in their district. Previously, Ara had taken special courses and received a certificate of high qualification and, very recently, he established his own business. Now, he has a beauty salon of his own. 

This is the main reason that Ara asks for a loan to buy all the needed equipment for his business (e.g., hair spray, hair mousse, hairdryer, different types of combs). Ara is sure that he will have great success in this business since he has good taste, skills, and he characterizes himself as a very hale and diligent person.

loans.use: to buy all the needed equipment for his business (e.g., hair spray, hair mousse, hairdryer, different types of combs).

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina is a small-scale gorcer in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has had some  formal education as she is a middle school level graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Philomina has been working as a petty trader, selling food ingredients for close to 7 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Philomena plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish, tomatoes, and powdered drinks, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish, tomatoes, and powdered drinks

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is a nipa weaver from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials for nipa weaving, like nipa palm, straw, and other materials. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. 

Consorcia dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for nipa weaving, like nipa palm, straw, and other materials.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has been involved in agriculture for  16 years already. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and 12-year-old daughter. Together with her family, Anna runs a farm. Anna keeps livestock which currently includes cows, pigs and chickens as well as owning agricultural land where different types of fruit and vegetables are grown (wheat, haricots, and apples).

Over these 16 years of hard work, Anna and her family have owned this farm which helps them to sustain their lives. Because the unemployment rate in Syuniq region is very high, this family's living comes from farming business. Now, by applying for this loan, Anna would like to expand that business. She plans to use the loan by purchasing five calves. This will help her to sell more milk and will significantly increase her income.

Anna hopes for your support!

loans.use: to pay for five calves

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
Doña María Vicenta tiene 30 años de edad es casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales estudian en una escuela de la comunidad con un grado de educación primaria incompleto y junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos vive el padre. Ella es agricultora desde hace mucho tiempo siendo su padre quien le enseñara a trabajar la tierra en lo que es el cultivo y siembra de papa a muy temprana edad y en compañía de su esposo cultivan maíz y frijol. El terreno es propio gracias a una herencia que le dejo su madre el cual está a 15 minutos de camino. Sus clientes son las mismas personas de la zona quienes sirven como intermediarios en otros mercados.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual planea comprar semilla de papa certificada, abono y fertilizantes para dar protección y seguridad a sus cultivos.   

Sus planes a futuro es producir en cantidad ofreciendo a sus clientes volumen y abarcando un mercado que aún no está cubriendo. Sus sueños como madre es poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y enviarlos a la universidad para que ellos puedan autorrealizarce en una etapa de sus vidas.
texts.en:
Maria Vicenta is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children who study at the local elementary school. She lives with her husband and children. She is an agricultural worker and has been doing this work for a long time, ever since her father taught her to work the land, sowing and harvesting potatoes when she was very young. Together with her husband, she grows corn and beans. She has her own land, thanks to an inheritance that her mother left her. Her land is a 15 minute walk from her house. Her clients are the people who live in the area and they work as intermediaries who sell the products at other markets. 

She has requested a loan from COMIXMUL communal bank with which she plans to buy certified potato seeds, manure, and fertilizers to protect and safeguard her crops.

Her future plans are to produce higher quantities of crops so that she can offer her clients a higher volume and be able to supply a market that she cannot provide for right now. Her dreams as a mother are to be able to pay for her children’s education and send them to a university where they can fulfill their potential in the future.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds, manure and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Olga Esther

texts.es:
Olga es una joven de 27 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de los Aquijes. Olga es una joven con un carisma contagiante, sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Olga con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de profesora, pero luego de buscar empleo y no encontrarlo tomo la decisión de iniciar su negocio de venta de comida, principalmente tamales, causas, tortas, entre otros., y con los ingresos de su pequeño negocio solventa los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo.

Olga está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder seguir mejorando su vivienda, de esta manera podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y así poder ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes ya que su negocio se encuentra en su vivienda, con esta mejora podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar a su familia a salir adelante”.
texts.en:
Olga is 27 and lives in the city of Ica in the district of Aquijes.  She is a young woman of infectious charisma who above all has a strong desire to succeed.  Through much effort she got a teaching degree but after seeking and not finding employment she made the decision to start a business selling food, namely tamales, causas [potato dumplings], sandwiches, etc.  With the income she makes from her small business she covers household expenses with a great deal of effort.

Olga really appreciates the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy construction materials to keep improving her house and provide a better quality of life to her family.  Her business is located in her house, so she'll be able to make her customers more comfortable, too.  With the improvement she'll be able to keep fighting to realize her biggest dream: to increase income and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora sells charcoal in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). Nora is a divorcee with 2 children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal for resale, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. 

As a middle school graduate, Nora understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She does farming in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops and raises cattle. Besides this, she also has a boutique shop and a money transfer business (M-pesa).

This being her second loan term, she plans to use the amount to buy cow feeds for her cattle and fertilizer for planting on her farm. She also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more clothes to sell in her boutique business. She hopes to generate more profits which will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Mary hopes to grow her business, make more income and consequently be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy cow feeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is divorced and has 4 children. After successfully graduating from middle school, Florence is now an established businesswoman. She cooks and sells rice and stew in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about 20 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Florence uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice, chicken, eggs, oil and tomatoes, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice, chicken, eggs, oil and tomatoes.

loans.name: Socrates Rodolfo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Ica, vive Socrates  de 38 años de edad, el cual día a día trabaja muy duro para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Sócrates trabaja en una pequeña empresa de seguridad y brinda sus servicios de vigilancia en un fundo agrícola de la zona; Sócrates labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo solventa los gastos del hogar con mucho esfuerzo y más aun saca adelante a su pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad.

Sócrates está muy agradecido con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder mejorar su vivienda, con lo cual mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Socrates is 38 years old and lives in the city of Ica. He works hard every day to provide for his family. He works for a small security business where he is a security guard for an agricultural plantation in the area. Socrates works around 9 hours a day and uses his wages to cover the household expenses and works hard to give the best to his young son who is 7 years old. 

Socrates is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders are offering him because thanks to their great help he can buy building supplies to improve his home, which will improve his family’s quality of life. He will continue doing his best to be able to realize his greatest dream: To give his son a good education and finish building his house with quality materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: David Raul

texts.es:
David es un joven de 20 años, el cual vive en la ciudad de ica, distrito de Tate. David es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, aunque en ocasiones ha atravesado por momentos difíciles, pero a pesar de ello ha logrado resolver los inconvenientes. Para poder apoyar a su familia David trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, recorre las calles de su distrito para buscar clientes y ofrecer sus servicios; en el día puede llegar a atender hasta 20 clientes y el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y trata de manera amable a los clientes. 

David está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo en buen estado para seguir trabajando y evitar tener accidentes; de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando cada día ´para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería de sistemas”.
texts.en:
David is 20 and lives in the city of Ica in the district of Tate.  He's a young man who really wants to succeed.  Although he's been faced with some difficulties at times, he has managed to overcome the roadblocks.  To support his family, David works as a taxi driver, traveling the streets of his district searching for passengers and offering his service.  In one day he's able to taxi around 20 passengers and he believes he is getting ahead because he's responsible and treats clients in a courteous manner.  

David really appreciates Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to do general maintenance on his taxi, which will allow him to have a vehicle in good shape so he can keep working and avoid accidents.  This way he will increase his income and keep fighting every day to achieve his biggest dream: to go to school for systems engineering.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Reyna Evelyn

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a cuidar sus 2 pequeños y a atender clientes en su pequeña tienda donde se encuentran artículos de primera necesidad y golosinas; inicio este negocio ya que veía la necesidad  de la gente; debido a que en la tienda que estaba mas accesible no se encontraban muchas cosa necesarias para la gente, entonces se decidió con el apoyo de su esposo en invertir $ 100 dólares para ver si funcionaba y ahora es la tienda donde hay mas variedad de productos y donde la gente va a comprar en sus necesidades


El préstamo será invertido en la compra de más productos para la tienda y otros que aun no se tienen y que son solicitados con frecuencia.

Se estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de las personas habitantes cercanas a esta tienda para que puedan tener a la mano los productos más necesarios y no tengan que caminar tanto o tener incluso que viajar hasta la ciudad para encontrarlos.

Se pretende pagar este crédito y luego si es necesario gestionar otro para seguir creciendo con su negocio para tener una tienda fuerte y bien surtida para  que la gente no tenga que salir hasta el pueblo o visitar otras tiendas.
texts.en:
Reyna is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She is a dedicated mother of two and also tends to clients in her small store where she sells basic necessities and sweets. She began the business because she saw that people needed a store because another store in the area wasn't selling what people needed. And so, she decided, with the support of her husband, to invest 100 dollars into a business to see if it worked and now the store has an even wider variety of products and it is where people go to buy what they need. 

The loan will be invested in purchasing more products for the store and also to purchase items that her customers request, but she doesn't currently have available. 

The demand of her customers won't be met until her store is able to have the things they need readily available and they don't have to walk long distances or to travel to find those things. 

She will pay back this loan, and then if it is possible, she will ask for another so she can continue to grow her business to have a strong and well stocked business so that people won't have to go to the next town over or visit other stores to get what they need.

loans.use: purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Сурайё 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина, которая является хранительницей очага дома и основной кормилицей. Сурайё более 26 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она имеет большой опыт и своих постоянных клиентов. Сурайё наставник многих других портних своего района. Ее муж не имеет постоянное место работы в Родине и поэтому он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию целью того, чтобы найти место работы и зарабатывать деньги для обеспечения семьи. Сурайё запрашивает займ на сумму 700 долларов США для покупки авиабилета для мужа. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Surayo is 39 years old.  She is married and raising two children.  She is a hardworking woman, who is a guardian of the home and primary provider.  Surayo has been providing seamstress services for over 26 years.  She has extensive experience and her own regular clients.  Surayo is a teacher to many other seamstresses in her district.  Her husband does not have a permanent place of employment in his native country and, thus, wants to go to the Russian Federation to find work and earn money to provide for his family.  Surayo is requesting a loan in the amount of 700 US dollars to purchase an airline ticket for her husband.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase an airline ticket for her husband, so that he can find a job in Russia

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is married with one child. She has received schooling until the end of senior high school. Currently, Rosemary sells soft drinks and other groceries in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been involved in this industry for about one year now. Her husband is in carpentry. 

Rosemary’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Rosemary will use the loan to increase her inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Rosemary plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a food vendor, who is involved in preparing and selling rice balls (mashed rice) and groundnut soup in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a farmer) support their four children. She has been involved in this business for five years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of  rice, groundnut paste, and fish, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. 

She aspires to use her profits, both to better market her food business and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of  rice, groundnut paste, and fish

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is married to an auto mechanic. She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses, as well as to save for a rainy day. As a senior high school graduate, Doris currently sells fried fish and operates a mobile mill in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). With over 10 years of experience in this trade, Doris sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more fish, cooking oil, and mill engine oil, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales.

Doris wants to make her business self-sustainable, as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her milling activity.

loans.use: to buy more fish, cooking oil, and mill engine oil

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta supplies and sells water in Kangundo town and she has been in this business for 5 years. She is 44 years old and married with 4 children. 

This will be her second loan term with KADET LTD and she hopes to buy plastic water cans for storing and supplying water within the area. These include homesteads and hotels. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to open a water supply shop and become successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy water cans for water supply.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Doña  es originaria de Esteli. Su oficio es comerciante, dueña de una pulperia la cual se ha dedicado por muchos años. Ella esta agradecida con kiva y Mi Credito ya que con su primer credito logro obtener mejores ingresos surtiendo su pulperia y asi darle una mejor satisfaccion a su clientes. Este nuevo credito lo solicita para comprar productos tales como: Granos basicos,papel higienico, jabon, medicina, etc.  Todos productos de mucha necesidad entre su clientela y de los cuales no puede carecer.Su objetivo es hacer crecer su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Antonia is originally from Esteli. She works as a retailer and has been running a convenience store for many years. She is grateful to Kiva and Mi Credito because her first loan enabled her to increase her income as she managed to increase her store's inventory and was able to satisfy more of her customer’s needs. She is requesting a new loan to buy products like staple grains, toilet paper, soap, medicines, etc., which are all products that are in high demand and essential to her store. Her goal is to grow her business and give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, toilet paper, soap, and medicine etc.

loans.name: Yesica Milagros

texts.es:
Yesica Milagros es una joven de 27 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago. Yesica es una joven con un carisma contagiante, sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Yesica con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de profesora, pero luego de buscar empleo y no encontrarlo tomo la decisión de iniciar su negocio de venta de comida, principalmente tamales, causas, tortas, entre otros., y con los ingresos de su pequeño negocio solventa los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo.

Yesica está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder seguir mejorando su vivienda, de esta manera podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y así poder ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes ya que su negocio se encuentra en su vivienda, con esta mejora podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar a su familia a salir adelante”.
texts.en:
Yesica Milagros is a 27 year old young woman who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago. Yesica is a young woman with an infectious charisma and above all she has a real desire to make a success of her life. Yesica put a lot of effort into studying to become a teacher but then after looking for work and not finding any she made the decision to start up her business selling food, mainly tamales, causas [a layered potato dish], cakes and other items. She makes a lot of effort to meet the household expenses from the income from her small business.

Yesica is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since the help they have given her has made it possible for her to buy building materials to keep improving her home. By doing this she can provide a better quality of life for her family and also make the shop more comfortable for her customers since it is in her house. With these improvements she will be able to continue working to make her biggest dream come true: to improve her income and help her family to get on in life.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional speakers and cables.

loans.name: Klodiana

texts.en:
Klodiana is a woman of the Roma ethnic group. She is a married mother of two children, who lives in a main city of central Albania.

She is requesting a loan for the first time, which she will use to buy second-hand shoes, to resell them at the market. She has been in this type of activity for several years, and she claims that it has been profitable somehow. 

“I have been able to make a little income through this, and that’s better than nothing, when you think of others who don’t even have the opportunity to make that money. Buying and selling used clothes, shoes and other items it is the best activity amongst members of our community. Not only do we have the necessary skills to do that, but we find it fun also -- talking to people and negotiating with clients, and buyers as well,” Klodiana said.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to resell

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De Bien Group

texts.es:
Dúo Solidario Mujeres de Bien  
Este dúo lo forma doña María Cancelaria, de 26 años de edad  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace 6 años, y como actividad secundaria se dedica a bordar y hace costuras de diferentes estilos y blusas, ella es una mujer casada tiene 2 hijos y vive en la aldea de Sacsuy y su negocio lo tiene en su casa y sale a vender en las casas de la aldea en donde ella vive y otros caseríos, solicita el crédito porque necesita comprar mas ropa tipica para la venta ya que viene la epoca en que muchas señoritas que trabajan en las fabricas llegan a pedirle diferentes estilos de ropa, además ella quieren aumentar comprando otros estilos y colores de blusas y cortes.
texts.en:
Dúo Solidario Mujeres de Bien Group was initiated by María Cancelaria. She is 26 years old. For the last six years she has sold traditional clothing. She also works embroidering and sowing different styles of blouses. She is married, has two children and lives in the village of Sacsuy. She does her work in her home and goes out to sell in her village and the surrounding hamlets.

María Cancelaria is requesting this loan because she needs to buy more traditional clothing to sell. It will soon be the time of year when many women who work in the fabric trade come and ask for different styles of clothing. She would like to increase the styles, cuts. and colors of blouses that she has.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Muhammadziyo

texts.ru: Мухамадзиё 18 лет. Он успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Теперь он уедет в столицу, чтобы продолжить учебу. Мухамадзиё планирует быть интеллигентным человеком как его родители. Его отец работает учителем в средней школе, а мать врачом. Мухамадзиё должен оплатить за учебный договор, но его родители не имеют достаточно денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhammadziyo is 18.  He graduated high school and has been admitted to the university so now he's going to the capital to continue his studies.  He plans to be an intellectual like his parents.  His father is a high school teacher and his mother is a doctor.  Muhammadziyo needs to pay for his studies but his parents don't have enough money.  He is seeking a loan to pay for school and is awaiting your benevolence.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university.

loans.name: Kenjekan

texts.ru: Кенжекан 50 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Трое из них взрослые и самостоятельная, вместе с Кенжекан проживает дочь, которая учится в 10 классе. Кенжекан имеет высшее образование. Работает на протяжении 32 лет в больнице в ночную смену, имеет очень хорошие отзывы коллег. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Кенжекан в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи с 2008 года дополнительно занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и кропотливому труду Кенжекан в хозяйстве имеется: 3 лошади, 4 коровы, 15 голов овец, а также имеет земельный надел в размере 1,20 ГА, на которой она сажает клевер, фасоль, клубнику. Ее деятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Кенжекан женить своих детей и обустроить их. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжекан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади. Доходы от кредита Кенжекан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также хочет дать достойное образование дочери.
texts.en: Kenjekan is 50 years old, a widow and has four children.  Three of her children are grown and independent, and Kenjekan's daughter, who attends 10th grade, lives with her.  Kenjekan has a higher education.  She has been working the night shift at the hospital for 32 years and is very well liked by her colleagues.  They says that she is a kind and hardworking woman.  To provide an additional source of income for her family, Kenjekan got involved in animal husbandry and farming in 2008, having started this business with 50,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent and diligent work, Kenjekan's business contains 3 horses, 4 cows, 15 sheep, and also a land plot of 1.20 hectares, where she plants clover, beans and strawberries.  Her business yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  The profits from the business allowed Kenjekan to marry off her children and provide for them.  In order to further develop her business, Kenjekan requested a loan in the amount of 125,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a horse.  Kenjekan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in a continued increase of her business, and also wants to give her daughter a decent education.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Please meet Ruth. She is from Liberia and lives in the Caldwell area of Montserrado County. This area is coming to be one of the more populated communities in Montserrado, due to some options like good roads, quiet, and lower house rental prices. 
       
Ruth is 32 years old and she completed 12th grade. She is married to a driver and they have a one-year-old child who is always with Ruth. Ruth is presently selling rubber dishes, such as cups, plates, spoons and bowls, and is also selling lappa (a traditional cloth mostly used in Africa by women). She started in business by selling frozen food seven years ago with a little money from her mother. She learned this way of selling from her friends.

Ruth received a loan of twenty thousand Liberian Dollars to buy more rubber dishes and lappa to increase her sales. She complains that the rainy season is the biggest challenge she faces since she does not have a shop. She admires her business because it makes her independent, and she is so proud of her business because from there she handles her own money. Her dream is to live a better life in the future, and hopes that one day her child will become president. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes and lappa (traditional cloth) to increase her sales.

loans.name: Salam S

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Salam.  He is single, and has no child. In 2011, Salam established his business, selling rice, sugar, and vegetable oil. He began his business, he said, "to fight my way through to further my education." His business is located in the outskirts of the city, and his main customers are neighbors and passersby. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL850,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL3,000,000. Salam requires a loan in order to buy bags of rice and sugar, and vegetable oil, to sell to his customers. He hopes that this loan will help attract more customers. In the future, Salam plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and sugar, and vegetable oil, to sell

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik lives in Artashat city, which is in the Ararat region, with her three children (two sons and a daughter) and her retired mother. Unfortunately her husband died several years ago, and after this loss Shushanik’s family became very upset and for a long time her children could not realize what had happened and why their usual life became so sad and colorless. However, we all know that whatever happens, independent of us, time heals. 

Before her husband died, Shushanik had never worked anywhere, but soon it was necessary to find some work. Today she works as a cook at one of the very famous and dainty restaurants of our city. Shushanik is doing her best to provide her family with normal living conditions. Her elder son has just come back from his military service, and in the near future her second son is going to complete his military service. 

Shushanik’s daughter is going to attend the Medical College. Recently, Shushanik got acquainted with a very clever young man who wants to get married to her daughter, so they have decided to organize a nice engagement party. Shushanik is asking for a loan in order to organize her daughter’s engagement party, to do some shopping connected with it, and to buy presents for her daughter and new son-in-law.

loans.use: To organize her daughter’s engagement party.

loans.name: Chiedza Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Lizzie from Mutare. She is married with three children, and they are all attending school. She also cares for two dependents. She belongs to the group called Chiedza Group.

Lizzie runs an agriculture business, selling chickens. The business has been in operation for ten years. She says the main challenge being faced is stiff competition in the poultry business. Lizzie has requested a loan of $400 to buy more chicks and feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. 

In the future, Lizzie plans to rent a plot for a poultry project.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Sylvanus

texts.en: After graduating from middle school, Sylvanus decided to set up his own auto mechanic business in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). With more than seven years of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to buy tires, engine oil, and other tools. He plans to use the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a teacher) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy tires, engine oil, and other tools.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman and a mother of two young children from Maribojoc, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in the neighborhood.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries, and cooking ingredients. With this loan, she will be able to improve the diversity of items at her store, thus allowing her to cater to more buyers.

Imelda dreams of expanding her business, so that it will become more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is single and has three children. After successfully graduating middle school, Caroline is now an established businesswoman. She sells second-hand clothing in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). She has been actively involved in this business for about 30 years. As the sole bread-winner in the family, Caroline uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Caroline will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of used clothing, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Caroline plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane-growing region. She has four children and has been doing farming work for six years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "It's a source of income for her family's needs." Her biggest challenge is: "Lack of market." Animals on the farm have not been named.

Zipporah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "It's customer-friendly."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "The interest rates are low."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked: "How will this loan benefit her family?," Zipporah replied: "It will improve our living standard."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Zipporah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and motorcycle,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile.' 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, and DVD,' but does not have: 'electricity, running water, or sewing machine.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is 26 years old, a married man, with one child. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen and he has a small grocery store. He works hard and has had the business for ten years. He started his business with small amount. 

Jameel wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan of YER 80,000 (Yemeni rials) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy grocery products in order to expand his product selection. In the future, Jameel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products in order to expand his product selection.

loans.name: Roddy Antonio

texts.es:
Roddy tiene 31 años, estuvo casado por 9 años y ahora atraviesa el fuerte obstáculo de la separación de su pareja, del fruto de su matrimonio tuvo 3 hijos que tienen 9 y 7 años de edad y el más pequeño 11 meses de nacido. Roddy aprobó la escuela primaria, conocimientos con los cuales ha trabajado desde muy joven como albañil apoyando en varias construcciones con el objetivo de que a sus hijos no les falte nada. 
Roddy vive en la Parroquia de Río Verde de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un puerto terrestre que moviliza el comercio ecuatoriano al unir las Regiones Sierra y Costa de ese país. Su clima es húmedo y la temperatura favorece a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. El comercio también ha crecido aportando al desarrollo económico de la zona. En este lugar han surgido varios jóvenes emprendedores que han aprovechado las oportunidades que su ciudad brinda para salir adelante.
Tal es el caso de Roddy, un albañil que desde hace 3 años emprendió con el negocio de crianza de pollos y cerdos para su posterior comercialización, actividad que aprendió desde niño con el ejemplo y enseñanzas de su padre que también se dedica a lo mismo. Roddy invierte en esta actividad 3 veces a la semana para no descuidar los trabajos de construcción en los que le contratan eventualmente, sin embargo, los días que no puede atender a los animales, paga a una persona para que se encargue de la alimentación y la supervisión de los mismos. Roddy ha podido recapitalizar sus ganancias comprando más pollos y cerdos pero es necesario para su manutención más alimento, para lo cual está solicitando un préstamo con el cual pueda comprar afrecho para los cerdos y balanceado para los pollos en cantidades grandes y así poder mantener bien alimentados y sanos a los animales de tal forma que Roddy pueda ofrecer a sus clientes un producto garantizado y con el adecuado control de calidad que demanda este negocio. Roddy sueña con crecer con su negocio y ver un día a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales de excelencia.
texts.en:
Roddy, age 31, was married for nine years.  He is now going through the big hurdle of the separation from his life partner.  They had three children, ages 9, 7, and 11 months.  Roddy has an elementary school education.  With that knowledge he has worked as a bricklayer since he was very young.  He has worked on various constructions with the objective of his children not having to do without anything.

Roddy lives in the Río Verde parish in the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province.  It is an inland port that moves Ecuadorian commerce upon joining the mountainous and coastal regions of this country.  Its climate is humid, and the temperature favors agricultural and livestock business activities.  Commerce has also grown, supporting the economic development in the area.

In this place several young entrepreneurs have emerged, and they have taken advantage of the opportunities that their city offers in order to get ahead.

This is the case with Roddy, a bricklayer.  Three years ago he undertook the business of raising chickens and pigs to later sell.  He learned this business activity as a boy by his father’s example and teachings.  He father also raises animals.  Roddy spends three times a week on this business activity so that he does not neglect any possible construction jobs that he is hired for.  Nevertheless, on the days that he cannot tend to the animals he pays a person to feed and take care of the animals.

Roddy has been able to recapitalize his earnings by purchasing more chickens and pigs.  However, he needs more feed to maintain the animals.  That is why he is requesting a loan to be able to buy large quantities of grains for the pigs and balanced feed for the chickens.  This way he will be able to keep his animals well-fed and healthy.  This way Roddy will be able to offer his customers guaranteed product, and he will have adequate control of the quality, which this business demands.  

Roddy dreams are to grow with his business and to one day see his children become excellent professionals.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.ru: Раногул целеустремленная женщина. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. С целью того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить семью, она 7 лет назад поступила на работу в детский садик. Она работает воспитательницей. Раногул довольно своей работой. Ее муж занимается земледелием. Итак, они являются людьми с маленьким доходом и поэтому в течение нескольких лет не могут купить холодильник, в котором сильно нуждаются. Раногул запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки холодильника. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ranogul is a motivated woman.  She's 46, married, and has 4 children.  In order to earn a living and provide for her family she started working 7 years ago as a kindergarten teacher, and she's happy with her work.  Her husband is in agriculture.  They have a low income stream, so in the next few years they won't be able to buy a refrigerator, which they really need.  Ranogul is seeking a loan of 1000 soms to buy a refrigerator.  She awaits your beneficence and is hopeful for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her household.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita is fish vendor from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four grown up children. Florita is has been in the business for more than 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and a weighing scale. With this, she will be able to improve her sales as well as her income. Florita dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a nipa weaver from Maribjoc, Bohol, which she has been doing for 20 years. Nipa is used as roofing in most typical Filipino houses.

Marilou is requesting for a loan, which she will use to buy more nipa palm. She will be able to weave more and sell more in the market. She hopes to be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to purchase nipa palm

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 33ans, Ablavi fait sa première demande à WAGES pour acheter des habits en friperie (activité qu’elle mène depuis 2000). Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère ouvrir une boutique et se marier plus tard.
texts.en: A young woman, Ablavi is 33 years old and is applying for her first WAGES loan to purchase secondhand clothing (a business she has been running since 2000). For the future, she hopes to open a shop and get married later on.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 37ans, Afi revend depuis 2011 des boissons dans un bar loué à cet effet. Aidée par une personne, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Comme perspectives d‘avenir, elle souhaite ouvrir un second bar et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille(Elle est mariée et mère d’01 enfant de 04ans).
texts.en: A young woman, Afi is 37 years old and has been selling beverage since 2011 in a bar she leases. Helped by one person, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. For the future, she would like to open a second bar and ensure her family is sufficient in food. (She is a married mother of a 4-year-old child.)

loans.use: to buy beverages for her bar

loans.name: Clecencia

texts.en:
Clecencia lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which has scarce available land. She has 3 children and has been farming for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "It's a source of income for my household needs." Her biggest challenge is: 'lack of market'. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Teresa'.

Clecencia was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Rates are customer friendly, and it meets my financial needs". This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. Her response: "Interest rates are low and they provide financial advice to clients."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'how will this loan benefit her family', Clecencia replied, "It will improve their living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Clecencia owns the following: 'cow, poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'electricity, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Nancy. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 12 years. 

In 2001, Nancy established her commercial batteries torchlight business. She began her business because she wanted to fight poverty and to be self-reliant. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. 

Nancy would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Nancy requires a loan in order to buy enough batteries and torchlights since she now has more customers. Nancy plans to rent a shop in the future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy batteries and torchlights to sell.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Sariar village of Shirak region, where he lives with his wife and son (both shown in the photo). Together with his family, Davit has been involved in agriculture for many years. He breeds cattle and cultivates wheat and barley. His wife uses the gathered milk to produce cheese, and Davit and his son sell that cheese locally. To tackle financial hardships, Davit from time to time also works as a driver and tries to gather more income for the family. 

Now this hard-working man, with a good credit history behind him, has requested this loan. The loan is important for him to purchase seeds, forage for feeding the livestock and fuel for transporting the gathered harvest and cheese to the market. Davit needs this loan in order to enlarge his farm and make it profitable.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, livestock feed and fuel for transporting his products to market

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man of 26 years, married to Violet, and a father of two children. He runs a general shop in Kangemi. He has been in this business for three years now and gets monthly income of KES 60,000 (Kenya shillings).

This will be Paul's first loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). He plans to use the entire loan to add to his stock and purchase food items, such as sugar, rice, cooking fat, and salt. 

In the future, Paul desires to buy his own shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat, and salt to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and is married to Vivian; they are blessed with two children. He has been in the wheat business for the last six years, and has a monthly income of 50,000 KES.

George has managed to get a second loan from KADET Ltd. for 100,000 KES, which he has used to purchase more wheat chemicals. The anticipated profit will be used to expand his investments.

George's hopes and dreams for his future are to have a successful business and raise a healthy family.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for wheat

loans.name: Fredy Edgar

texts.es:
Fredy tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza pro su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura. Cada día Fredy se levanta con mucho optimismo, sobre todo porque es padre de 2 pequeños de 5 y 1 añitos, a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes da la vida con tal de verlos felices.  Es por ello cada día Fredy trabaja como chofer de un bus de transporte urbano, trabajo con el cual puede sacar a su familia adelante a pesar de las adversidades, Fredy labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable en su trabajo.

Fredy está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que presenta muchas grietas, productos de los movimientos telúricos que ha ocurrido en la zona en los últimos meses, de esta manera podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión  a sus hijos y tener una empresa de buses”.
texts.en:
Fredy, 25, lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its warm and friendly climate. It is also an agricultural city. Every day, Fredy wakes up feeling very optimistic, mainly because he is a father to two young children, ages 1 and 5. He loves his children very much and gives everything he has to make them happy. This is why Fredy works every day as an urban bus driver. Despite adversity, he is able to provide for his family with his job. Fredy works for about 9 hours per day and he believes that he is successful because he is very responsible in his work.

Fredy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy construction materials to make improvements to his home. His house has many cracks due to the movements of the earth in his region over the past few months. He will then be able to give his family a better quality of life and continue fighting every day to make his greatest dream come true: to give his children a profession and to have a bus company.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
Doña María  es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Tiene 48 años de edad y casada. Es de oficio comerciante, dueña de un puesto de granos básicos. Negocio que  inicio por iniciativa propia y con mucho sacrificio  a los 45 años  de edad. Esta es su única fuente de ingreso.
Su expectativa es que su negocio crezca, tenga mucho más cliente y que sea reconocido en todo su vecindario. Su meta futuro es poder vender granos básicos al por mayor  a todas las pulperías de su sector y comprarse un medio de transporte que facilite distribuirlos. Está solicitando el préstamo para comprar: arroz, frijoles y maíz.
texts.en:
María is from the city of Estelí.  She’s 48-years-old and married.  She’s a merchant and owns a basic grains stand.  She started the business at the age of 45 on her own initiative and with much sacrifice; it is her only source of income.

Her hope is that the business will grow, that it will have more customers and that it becomes well known throughout her neighborhood.  Her future goal is to be able to sell basic grains at wholesale to all the grocery stores in her sector and to buy herself a means of transport that will make distributing them easier.  She’s asking for the loan to buy rice, beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and corn.

loans.name: Arjan

texts.en:
A loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek will enable Arjan to buy some equipment and tools for his auto-service shop. He opened up his shop about six years ago, and since then it has been going well. According to him, “I was scared at first despite the desire to do something on my own, since I had no other employment choices. I could not let go of the fear for some time. Even though this was something small, there might be implications both financial and otherwise, but Thank God, everything has been going well so far, and I’ve no complaints.” 

Arjan is 35 years old and has three children, ages 10, 6 and 2, and their family lives in a village where the majority of villagers fall below the extreme poverty line, according to USAID poverty measurement tailored specifically for Albania.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for his auto-service shop.

loans.name: Narendra

texts.en:
Narendra is a 45-year-old differently able person staying with his wife and his only child. He has a tea and food stall in his village. He sells tea, some local snacks like samosa (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), idli (a popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice), wada (lentil doughnut), etc. He earns 5,000 INR per month, which is used for his household expenditures. His wife helps him in his business to purchase the raw materials. 

Narenda wants to repair his food stall and purchase some furniture (benches, table) to seat his customers, and utensils like plates, spoons, etc. This will attract the customers and increase his monthly income. He also wants to add few more items like toothbrushes, hair oil, shampoo, soap, potatoes, onions, etc. to extend his business and make it a variety store.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to fulfill his above requirements. He says in this way, he can earn 6,500 to 7,000 INR per month and would be able to construct a house and give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for his food stall and to add some other household consumables in his shop.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is a 32-year-old, married man, with two children, living in a suburb of the capital city, Tbilisi. Besik’s wife stays at home, taking care of her children. Besik is self-employed and serves the people with his own car. He works on special orders and mainly tourists are his regular clients.

Unfortunately, several days ago his car was out of order and it’s impossible for Besik to continue working. He is requesting the credit to fix the car. Besik's request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Micro Finance Organization Credo (MFO Credo), permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.
 
A loan of USD 650 will help Besik to pay for the maintenance of his car. He will continue working and will transport the passengers throughout the country. 

Besik is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person, with a great desire to provide his children with a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Besik is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to repair the car and continue working as a driver.

loans.name: Star Four Group

texts.en:
Nyarai is 29 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She is from Mutare. Nyarai belongs to the Star Four Group. Nyarai  sells potatoes, maize, beans, and tomatoes, which she has been doing for four years. 

Nyarai has requested a loan for $400, which she will use to buy more potatoes and beans to sell. Her main challenge is a shortage of some products during the off-season, which affects her sales. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to send her children to school and  improve her family's welfare. In the future, Nyarai plans to buy a truck for transporting her products to the market.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, maize, beans, and tomatoes

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Madame   ARAME   est  une  femme     mariée    qui  vit au Sénégal. Elle a deux bénéficié de l’appui financier de l’UIMCEC. Actuellement elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de mangue a revendre au niveau des marchés. Son objectif est de diversifier son activité de commerce de tissus et de parfums  dans le but de maximiser ses bénéfices pour mieux prendre en charge les frais de transport et de paiement de facture  pour sa famille. Elle projette d’avoir une cantine au marché.
texts.en: Ms. ARAME is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has twice benefited from financial support from U-IMCEC. She is currently requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for purchasing mangoes to sell at the markets. He goal is to diversify her business, where she sells cloth and perfumes, with the goal of maximizing her profits, so as to do better covering transport costs and paying the bills for her family. She is planning on having a stall at the market.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes to sell

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Bendicion De Sacsuy Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO BENDICION DE SACSUY
Este dúo lo forman las señora María Emilia quien tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos nos cuenta que ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace 2 años, nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para comprar ropa típica ya que empieza la época escolar y ella vende blusas de color de uniformes, también cortes y trata la manera de comprar suéteres y vendérselos a un buen precio a las personas, el capital que ella no le es suficiente ya que la demanda de sus clientes es bastante y por eso esta solicitando este credito, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado y les envia saludos en donde quiera que se encuentren y les da gracias por ayudarla en su negocio que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
Solidario Bendicion de Sacsuy Duo

María Emilia is one of the members of this duo. She is 46 and married with four children. She has made a living selling traditional clothing for two years. She says that she has applied for this loan to buy traditional clothing, since the school year is beginning and she sells colored shirts for uniforms as well as shorts. She would also like to buy sweaters, which she will sell at a good price. 

Her capital is not sufficient for this purchase because her clients' demand is high, which is why she has applied for a loan. She hopes that you will be able to help her with this loan. She sends her greetings to wherever you are and thanks you for helping her with her business. May God bless you.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Djouweratou

texts.fr: Djouweratou est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée  et a 1 enfant en charge. Elle vend des produits céréaliers et ignames à toutes les personnes à la maison. Elle achète les produits au grand marché. Elle travaille seule. Djouweratou a requis son second crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits céréaliers et des ignames. Dans les prochaines années, Djouweratou voudrait étendre son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Djouweratou is a 30-year-old woman who is married, and she has one child to support. She sells grains and yams to all comers to her house. She purchases her products at the big market. She works alone. Djouweratou has requested her second WAGES loan to purchase some grains and yams. For the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that, with the profits, she plans on having a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase grains and yams to sell

loans.name: Feristar

texts.en:
Ferister is 41 years old, married and has 4 children. She does farming in Kangundo town where she plants maize, beans and vegetables for seling. She also keeps cattle which she usually sells.

This is her second loan term from KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of feeds for her cattle. She also plans to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She will use the anticipated income from the sale of her farm produce and livestock business to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her farming business by planting more cash crops to sell.

loans.use: To buy cow feeds, seeds and fertilizer for planting..

loans.name: Kokoyo

texts.en:
Kokoyo is 53 years old and is married to Manteya; they are blessed with ten children. Kokoya has been in the agriculture business for the last ten years and has a monthly income of 2,100 KES. 

He has received his second loan from KADET for 20,000 KES, which he has used to purchase fertilizers and pestcide. He will use the anticipated profit to buy goats for fattening. His hope and dream is to be the best and most successful man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pestcide

loans.name: Yuly Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Yuly, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 6 años que estudian en la escuela. El marido es artesano. 

Doña Yuly realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual tiene un taller de ebanistería en su casa, lugar donde realizan muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas, puertas, camas, entre otros productos, trabaja de lunes a sábado y a veces hasta los domingos si tiene obras para entregar, el realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento aunque cuando no tiene trabajos el también trabaja para otra persona. Ella por su parte también prepara comida los fines de semana por las noches, vende en su casa o entrega a domicillo, así ella le ayuda a su marido cuando él no tiene trabajo. 

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar madera, pintura, selladores y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace ya 3 años y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la institución. 

Su sueño es tener un restaurante ya que según ella cocina delicioso.
texts.en:
The La Victoria community bank meets every 15 days in the neighbourhood of La Victoria in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by tourists year-round, and for being a city of unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions. Señora Yuly, lives here. She is 29 years old and has a partner with whom she has two children, aged 9 and 6, who go to school.

Yuly is requesting a loan to help her partner, who has a joinery workshop in their home, where he makes a lot of furniture, such as chairs, doors, beds, and other items. He works from Monday to Saturday, and sometimes works on Sundays too if he has work to complete. He makes furniture for customers who come to his workshop, but when there's no work, he also works for someone else. 

In the evening at the weekend, Yuly prepares food which she sells in their home or takes to the customer's house. This is she helps her partner when he doesn't have any work. 

They are going to use this loan to buy wood, paint, sealant and supplies to make food. She has been a member of the community bank for 3 years and she likes it because of the additional benefits the establishment offers. Her dream is to have a restaurant, because she says that she cooks delicious food.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sealant and supplies.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob lives in the village of Azatamut in the Gegharkunik region.  He is married and has two daughters. 

Farming is the main occupation that Hakob and his family are engaged in. They keep two cows, two calves, six piglets and twenty chickens on their farm.  Their only income is from farming; it has given Hakob a chance to buy some furniture for their house, and he has managed to buy a car for himself. They also have a plot of land and cultivate greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, and some fruits for their family's everyday use.
