Hakob says that he loves farming, taking care of animals, and breeding them.  He is sure that land cultivation is also of great use for a man; it makes a man kinder and wiser, and happiness has no borders when you gather the harvest so nice, so colorful, and sweet which you have raised by days and nights of working hard. 

Hakob wants to enlarge his farm cattle, and he plans to buy one more cow and a lot of animal fodder.  He is asking a loan from Kiva lenders, as he is not able to do it himself with his own resources.

loans.use: To buy one more cow and a lot of animal fodder for his farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has three children and lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She is a farmer, which she has been doing for 19 years. Her primary income sources are milk and personal business. Her biggest challenge is transporting her produce to the market. 

Irene is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase a dairy cow. Her highest monthly expense is transportation costs. The loan will benefit her family with an increased income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Irene owns the following: poultry but does not own cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nenyasha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 45-year-old Judith, from Mutare. She is married, with four children and three are attending school. She also cares for four other dependents. 

Judith belongs to Nenyasha Group. Judith runs a retail business which sells vegetables, potatoes, and sweet potatoes. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges she is facing are that of high transport cost and a bad road network. 

Judith has requested a loan of USD 600 to increase her funds in order to buy a truck for her business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. 

In the future, Judith plans to divert her business into a piggery.

loans.use: to buy a truck for her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 25 years old and married. They have one child and live in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hardworking and enthusiastic man. Every day he works hard running his small grocery store, where he sells staple items. He believes his business is successful because he is very charismatic with his customers and always offers quality products at fair prices. 

He is asking for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items which will help him increase his income and provide better service to his customers. He continues to work hard to realize his dream, which is to have a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy grocery items which will help him increase his income and provide better service to his customers.

loans.name: Nilda Lidia

texts.es: Nilda, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene  tres hijos y vive en una aldea de las Vegas, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene un negocio de ventas de novedades, ofrece ropa, zapatos, juguetes, adornos para el hogar etc. Se ha dedicado a las actividades del hogar y hace  8 años decidió por su propio negocio, el cual ha mantenido activo mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. El préstamo que solicito  es el noveno ciclo en ODEF que es por la cantidad de L.18, 000, con este podrá invertir mas en su tiendita en la compra de mercadería (ropa, adornos, utensilios del hogar, zapatos, juguetes y otros). Su plan es poder ampliar su negocio ya que es su única y gran fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Nilda is 37 years old and in a common-law relationship. She and her partner have three children and live in a neighborhood of Las Vegas, Santa Bárbara.

Nilda has a business where she sells novelties such as clothes, shoes, toys, household decorations, and other items. She had dedicated herself to the household activities, but eight years ago she decided to start her own business. The business has remained active since she has invested several loans.

The loan she is requesting is her ninth request with ODEF and is in the amount of 18,000 HNL. The money will be invested in her store by purchasing merchandise (clothes, decorations, household utensils, shoes, toys, and other items). Her plan is to expand her business since it is her only and largest source of income.

loans.use: to buy clothes, decorations, household utensils, shoes, toys, and other items.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mme Akouvi a 32ans. Elle est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, huile végétale), des pagnes et bazins. Son conjoint est tailleur et ils ont un enfant de 03ans en charge. Elle est dans cette activité depuis 2007 et s’y plait beaucoup. Elle est à son troisième prêt et cet argent lui permettra d’acheter des marchandises pour mieux relancer son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et fait la vente à toutes personnes dans sa maison. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère ouvrir d’autres boutiques et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Ms. Akouvi is 32 years old. She is a retailer of staple foods (rice, sugar, vegetable oil), and also 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and damask fabrics. Her husband is a tailor, and they have a 3-year-old child to support. Ms. Akouvi has been in this business since 2007 and is very please with it. She is on her third loan, and this money will enable her to purchase some merchandise for boosting her business further. She gets her supplies from Lomé and make her sales to anyone at the house. For the future, she hopes to open other shops and ensure her family's self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to buy staple goods, 'pagne' cloth, and damask fabrics to sell

loans.name: Dogbovi

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant de 04ans, qui est scolarisé, madame Dogbovi a pour époux chef magasinier. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des mèches dans une boutique. Elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième crédit pour acheter des produits pour revendre à la population. A l’avenir, elle veut augmenter son stock de marchandises et s’occuper de la famille. Elle est âgée de 31ans et est dans ce domaine il y a 07ans.
texts.en: A mother with a 4-year-old child in school, Ms. Dogbovi has a husband who is a shopkeeper. To help her husband in covering household expenses, she sells hair extensions in a shop. She is requesting a third loan from WAGES to purchase some products to sell to people. In the future, she wants to increase her stock of merchandise and take care of her family. She is 31 years old and has been in this business for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions to sell in her shop

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a merchant from Corella, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in his locale. 

Renato is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this, he will be able to improve his store and attract more buyers. 

Renato dreams of making his business a success and saving money for the schooling of his three young children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 30 years old, not married and not supporting anyone. He has been in the wheat business for the last six years with a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

Raphael has managed to get the third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, and used the loan to purchase fertilizers for wheat. He will use the anticipated profit to buy more goats and sheep. 

His hopes and dreams are to add more effort in his business to get more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for wheat.

loans.name: Diana Marjorie

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  13, 11 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Doña Diana es una muy buena esposa y ama de casa que para obtener sus ingresos se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa, zapatillas y bisutería. Su forma de venta es puerta para lo cual sale en las mañanas a realizar sus recorridos aprovechando que sus hijos están en el colegio y solo tiene que llevar al más pequeño, lleva 8 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas y bisuteria. Lleva 3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejoro su negocio. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenas personas y profesionales.
texts.en: “La Victoria” [Victory] communal bank meets every fifteen days in “La Victoria” neighborhood in Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited frequently in all seasons. It is also known as a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.  In this place, lives Diana, a 35 year old woman.  She is married and has three children, ages 13, 11, and 3; the two oldest are in school.  Her husband is engaged in fishing.  Diana is a very good wife and housewife.  To obtain income, she is engaged in a business where she sells clothing, slippers, and costume jewelry.  She sells door-to-door and goes out in the mornings to make her rounds, taking advantage of the time that her children are in school and she only has to take the smallest child with her.  She has been engaged in this business for eight years and it allows her to get ahead.  This loan is for the purchase of clothing, slippers, and costume jewelry.  She has been with the communal bank for three years and likes it because she improves her business with the loans.  Her dream is that her children are good people and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, slippers, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: María Andrea

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Ella vive sola con sus hijos por los cuales lucha todos los días para darles lo mejor. 

Doña María para salir adelante sola y que nada les falte a sus hijos trabaja muy duro, ella trabaja en un restaurante de un casino de la Armada, allí por su labor recibe un sueldo semanal, además de trabajar para otras personas ella los fines de semana en las noches prepara meriendas, ella varia el menú para no cansar a sus clientes y que estos quedan satisfechos con sus platos. Ella va a utilizar el crédito para ampliar su negocio que tiene los fines de semana.

Este crédito es para comprar mesas, sillas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan con los créditos para incrementar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un restaurant.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Victoria meets every two weeks in the La Victoria neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which tourists visit year round, and for being a wonderfully beautiful place with many tourist attractions. María, 36, lives here and is the single mother of three children, ages 13, 11, and 6. Her oldest child is in high school, and the younger children are in primary school. She lives alone with her children, for whom she strives to provide the best each day.  

María works hard in the restaurant of an army casino to get ahead and make sure her children have everything they need. She is paid weekly, and she also prepares dishes for others on weekend evenings. She changes the menu so that her customers don't get bored and are happy with her dishes.

She will use this loan to grow her weekend business by buying tables, chairs, and ingredients to prepare her foods. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years and is happy to have the chance to obtain loans to grow her business. She dreams of having a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and supplies.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of twelve women who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. These people work as merchants. They are very hard workers and their main goal is to provide for their families. They are kind and courteous people who still maintain their culture and traditions. 

One of the members of this group is Mary. She has belonged to this group for three years, and she is on her fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She loves to be a member of this group because of the team spirit that exists among all of the members, which makes the group very solid. 

Mary is 41 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage. Her children are sixteen and fourteen years old, and are school-going children. She needs to make a lot of money to care for the family. Her husband works in construction and they own the small house where they live.

Mary spends most of her time taking care of her family, but she is always looking for ways to improve her household's financial stability, which is why she works by selling ice-chests, plates and other plastic products. Her goal is to own a shop so that she can make enough money for her family. 

Her group members are into coco-yam, eggs, fish, cosmetics and gari (fried cassava paste), and they need a total amount of GHS 6,100 to improve upon their businesses.

loans.use: to buy and sell ice chests, plates and other plastic products.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
This is Cecelia from Liberia. She lives in the Caldwell area in Montserrado County. This area is becoming one of the more populated communities in Montserrado due to some options, such as good roads, quietness, and the lower cost of house rental.
 
Cecelia is 43 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 20 and 14, and only the young one stays at home and attends school. Her husband is a local businessman. She has been running a table business in the Caldwell market from which she sells rice, pepper, soap and oil, etc.  She is asking for a loan to buy enough rice, pepper, soap, oil, etc. to increase her sales. She complains that the lack of stable prices is the major problem she faces now. 

She started this business with a little money from her husband fifteen years ago, by selling cookies in her community. She enjoys her business because she earns her own money, and she is so proud of her business because it makes her independent. Her plans are to one day own a house, and to see her children attending university in the near future. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC.

loans.use: to buy enough rice, pepper, soap, oil, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Susanta

texts.en:
Susanta is a 24-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents and his elder brother. He has a variety shop in his village. He has ten years of experience in this business. His brother assists him in purchasing the goods for his shop. He sells betel, biscuits and wafers, spices, lentils, and cooking oil, and earns 5,000 INR per month from this business. 


There is another betel shop in his village to compete with this shop. The total population of this village is 700, and the people depend on these two shops for their household goods. Susanta is not able to reach the growing demand in the present scenario.

He wants to purchase more stock and a variety of spices, oil, and personal care merchandise like shampoos, detergents, and toothpaste than he is selling right now. He also wants to purchase more variety of chocolates and wafers.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to add to his shop some more stock of what he sells.

loans.use: to purchase shampoos, detergents, toothpaste, oil, spices and other household consumables for his variety shop.

loans.name: Atheer Group

texts.en:
Oumayya is the featured borrower of the Atheer group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Oumayya is a 45-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working in her home products sales shop for seven years. She is a hard worker with a very good reputation. She makes an effort to update her shop with newly released items in order to keep her customers pleased and excited to check new collections.

She has applied for a loan that will be invested in supporting her business through diversifying her products with newly released items. She is planning to start a new 'balloons and flowers' shop in the future when she can afford the opening expenses.

Oumayya is the one wearing grey, the second one sitting from the right side. As for the other members, Zeina is the lady standing, wearing dark blue, Ibtissam is wearing blue sitting at the far right of the picture, and Juliet is the one in the pink shirt at the left.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly released items.

loans.name: Lamita Group

texts.en:
Faten is the featured borrower of the Lamita Group. She is sitting at the far right, wearing light red. Faten is a 31-year-old mother of three children. For the past four years, she has been selling home plastic products, such as Tupperware, to help her husband provide a living. She joined with her friends and neighbors to form a loan group with the Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Other group members include: Ibtissam, a 43-year-old widowed mother of two (wearing blue shirt and sitting in the middle), and Manahel, a 33-year-old married mother of one child, sitting at the far left.

Faten will use her portion of the loan to purchase merchandise. She sells cosmetics and will also use her loan to update her new summer collection. In the future, Faten hopes to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase home plastic products

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 54 years old, from Ndambibi in Naivasha, and is married with five children who are between the ages of 30 and 12 years old. James has a carpentry business that he has been running for the past 4 years, and he has applied for his sixth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy more timber to use in his workshop. He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more timber to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a man of thirty nine years, married to Rose and the father of two children. He is a pig farmer, and has been in the business for ten years; he gets a monthly income of 35,000 shillings.

This will be Nelson's seventh loan with KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy twenty piglets.  

In the future, once he gets the funds for supplies, he plans to supply farmers with pork products.

loans.use: To purchase twenty piglets

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal has been earning a living though her hog-raising business for more than three years now. She lives with her family in the town of Panglao, Bohol. 

Rosal is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and also feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and also feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 34 years old; he lives in the village of Shikahogh, which is in the Syunik region.  Armen is a very strong-willed and diligent person. Since he lives completely alone, he single-handedly manages farming, and receives a decent income both for him, and his parents, as well. 

During a training exercise in the military service, Armen was wounded in the leg and, unfortunately, his leg was amputated. Afterwards he returned to his native village and lived with his grandparents. His parents live in the city of Kapan. Several years ago, both his grandfather and grandmother died and now he lives completely alone. 

He says he feels full of energy, is a strong man, and he is able to solve any difficulties which can occur during farming. He breeds three cows, and sells dairy products at the Kapan and Kajaran wholesale markets to his loyal customers.
 
Armen wants to enlarge his farm, so he asks a loan to buy a lot of chickens, a bull, and animal fodder. He is sure that very soon, thanks to his farm profit, he will be able to get married and have his own lovely family.

loans.use: To buy a lot of chickens, a bull, and animal fodder

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo lives in the city of Kapan, which is in the Syunik region. He has a specialty of geologist, but he has never worked in his specialty. Kamo is married and has three daughters. His daughters do not work. The youngest studies at the musical college. Kamo’s wife works as a cleaner. 

It is already three years since Kamo established his own business. In his own garage, he sells a large, very large variety of car spare parts. He has nearly everything connected with cars and their care. His garage is well known and famous in his city, and his business is going ahead. He is happy to be able to provide normal living conditions to his family.

Kamo asks for a loan in order to renew the assortment of his car spare parts. This will help him to have more income and more new clients.

loans.use: to renew the assortment of his car spare parts, which will help him to have more income and more new clients.

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
Ziporah is a 53-year-old mother living in Kobiero in Homabay county in Kenya. She supports five people in her family and is married to Fred, who is a businessman.

Ziporah is a small scale retailer;she has been running a bookshop for the last four years and gets a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

Ziporah is taking her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more books. She will use the anticipated profit to purchase more bookshop materials.

Her dream is to be successful retailer.

loans.use: To buy books to sell

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es: Francisco es un humilde comerciante de la zona de Esteli que se dedica a la elaboracion de productos de cuero desde hace 30 años. El ha sido beneficiado atravez de MiCredito y Kiva esto la ha permitido ampliar mas su taller , tiene mas clientela ha mejorado sus ingresos. Ahora el esta requiriendo el credito para comprar una máquina de cocer industrial que pone sellos en cuero. Esto le permitira tener mas facilidad al realizar su trabajo y entregar producto de calidad. Su meta futuro es comprar una maquina moderna y contratar personal.
texts.en: Francisco is a humble trader from the Esteli region who has made a living making leather products for thirty years. He has benefited from MiCredito and Kiva, which has allowed him to expand his workshop. He has a larger clientele and has improved his income. He currently needs this loan to buy an industrial sewing machine which stamps leather. This will allow him to do his work with greater ease and to turn out a good-quality product. His goal for the future is to buy a modern machine and to hire staff.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine which can emboss leather.

loans.name: Enedina Fedelinda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Enedina, tiene 52 años y es soltera, vive en casa de unos familiares. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en el banco sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.

Doña Enedina es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella le ayuda a su tía en el lugar donde vive a realizando trabajos de cocina y arreglos del lugar, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende donde ella vive, sale en sus ratos libres a realizar sus recorridos y esto no impide  cumplir con sus obligaciones en casa de su tía,  lleva dos  años  que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta y así tener para sus gastos personales.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Victoria meets every two weeks in the La Victoria neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which tourists visit year round, and for being a wonderfully beautiful city with many tourist attractions. Enedina, 52, is single and lives here in a relative's house. This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank, which she likes because the members are close and responsible. 

Enedina likes working to get ahead. She helps her aunt with the household cooking and cleaning, but she also sells a variety of clothing from her house and door-to-door. In her free time, she travels, but this doesn't keep her from doing her chores at her aunt's house. She has been doing this work for several years, which has allowed her to earn her own income and pay her personal expenses. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, comenta que dentro de unos años se ve terminando la carrera y aplicando todo lo que aprendió por medio de sus estudios.
Su familia es quien lo inspira a poder estudiar, en especial sus padres que siempre han estado con el para apoyarle en todo. Es una persona responsable y honesta, que se está esforzando por salir adelante.
Pide esta ayuda para poder invertirla en pagar sus clases de la universidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir con sus estudios. Esta agradecido por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Jorge is studying business administration in the city of San Lorenzo. He says he will complete his degree in a few years and apply all he has learned in school. His family, especially his parents who have always supported him, inspired him to study. 

Jorge is responsible and honest and works hard to succeed. He has asked for a loan to pay for college courses. The loan will help him continue his studies. He is grateful for this chance, which will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay for college courses.

loans.name: Genesa

texts.en:
Genesa runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in Maribojoc, Bohol. Genesa has been in this business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store as well as her stock, thus attracting more buyers and customers. Genesa dreams of expanding her store and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera has had a previous loan with Kiva that ended without problems. She owns rental houses and a school. She now seeks another Kiva loan to finish painting some of the houses that were not done. She has had a previous loan with Milango prior to being listed on Kiva. She repaid all her loan without problems. The major challenge that she faces is that some of her tenants do not pay rent on time. She is a proud mother of four.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a teacher with 15 years of experience teaching at a local school. She lives in Hartashen village of Syuniq region which is famous for its cold and severe climate. Locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some in limited land cultivation. 

Together with her work at school, Gayane, in order to tackle financial difficulties, is involved in agriculture. She breeds cattle (sheep, cows, calves) and cultivates some wheat and haricot (beans). Gayane is very hardworking and breeds cattle with great love and care. Together with her husband, Gayane does her best to sustain her 3 school age children's living. 

Now, this woman is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders for enlarging her farm. She plans to purchase 2 cows and increase the production of milk and meat. Gayane hopes for your support!

loans.use: to pay for two cows.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 20-year-old student from the small town of Jinvali. Several days ago, he was married and now lives with his wife in his own house. The only income source for the family is money transfers from Russia, where Lasha’s father lives and works. As this income is not enough for the newlywed couple, Lasha decided to start up a business and become financially independent.

Unfortunately, Lasha was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required a stable income and business experience as a precondition to a loan. But Lasha has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to country vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products. 

With a loan of 3,000 USD, Lasha will start up a grocery store and buy merchandise to stock it. Lasha will care for his clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this determination and his loan, he expects to improve his income and get a quality university education.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
32-year-old Hazel is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 6 and 11. Hazel has a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells basic household commodities like canned goods, seasonings, detergent, snacks, rice, and soft drinks. 

She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy rice, canned goods, and hog feed. 

She hopes that with her income, she can help meet family needs such as food and school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, and hog feed

loans.name: Asnath

texts.en:
Asnath is 32 years old and married with two children. For the past two years, she has run a beauty shop in Kitengela town. Asnath earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. Her husband also works to provide for the basic needs of the family. 

Asnath is requesting her first loan with KADET LIMITED to buy more stock of cosmetics and hair products for her beauty shop. She will use the profits from her loan to buy more beauty products. In the future, Asnath dreams of having a stable income and business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair products for her beauty shop

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 36 years old and married with eight children. For the past three years, she has run a retail shop located in an industrial area of Nairobi town. Pamela's husband, Paul, is employed and provides extra income to provide for the basic needs of their family. She currently makes 15,000 KES monthly. 

Pamela is requesting her first loan with KADET LIMITED to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and salt to boost her stock. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to educate her children. Pamela hopes to grow her business and make more income to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Las Autenticas Group

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 36 años, trabajó desde muy joven ayudando a sus padres y los conocimientos que adquirió en la primaria no le abrieron muchas puertas laborales, sin embargo se dedicó a los quehaceres de su hogar mucho tiempo, ella está casada con Segundo un hombre trabajador de 46 años que es chofer profesional y trabaja conduciendo un taxi por las calles de la ciudad y con quien Beatriz tiene un hijo que está en la escuela fiscal y a quien esperan un día verlo convertido en profesional y que aporte al mejoramiento del país. Beatriz vive con su familia en la Parroquia de Río Verde de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un puerto terrestre que moviliza el comercio ecuatoriano al unir las Regiones Sierra y Costa de ese país. Su clima es húmedo y la temperatura favorece a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. El comercio también ha crecido aportando al desarrollo económico de la zona. En este lugar han surgido varios jóvenes emprendedores que han aprovechado las oportunidades que su ciudad brinda para salir adelante, como es el caso de Beatriz que desde hace algún tiempo decidió aportar con el gasto de su hogar para mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia, ella vende cosméticos de forma ambulante, recorre las largas calles de su ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, haciendo las entregas y cobranzas respectivas a sus clientes que en su mayoría son mujeres. Beatriz solicita un préstamo justamente para poder comprar productos de los más demandados usando las ofertas que sus proveedores le brindan para así mantener productos en stock y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes más exigentes. Ella espera incrementar sus ganancias de tal forma que pueda solventar algunos gastos en su hogar y poder dar a su hijo una vida y educación confortables.
Junto a Beatriz se han unido 2 de sus amigas quienes también desempeñan el papel de microempresarias, ellas son Angélica y Decci. 
Angélica tiene 33 años, está casado y se dedica también a la venta de cosméticos, ella invertirá en mercadería que le incremente sus ganancias y así poder dar a sus 2 hijos un mejor estilo de vida.
Decci tiene 34 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella invertirá su parte del préstamo para comprar pollos y balanceado para la alimentación de los mismos, pues se dedica a la crianza de pollos para su comercialización. 
Estas tres mujeres se unieron con un objetivo común: renunciar a todo pretexto por la falta de trabajo y crecer con su emprendimiento para demostrar a todos que si es posible salir adelante esforzándose y trabajando duro.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 36, started to work at a very young age to help her parents. The knowledge which she gained in primary school did not open many doors for her in the labor market. Nevertheless, she dedicated herself to the household duties for a long time. She is married to Segundo, 46, a hardworking man who is a professional taxi driver in the city. He and Beatriz have one son, who is in a state school. They hope that one day he will become a professional who contributes to the country's improvement. 

Beatriz lives with her family in the parish of Río Verde in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a terrestrial port which mobilizes trade between the Sierra and Costa regions of Ecuador. Its climate is humid and favorable for agriculture and livestock. Trade has also grown, bringing economic development to the region. 

In this area, various young entrepreneurs have taken advantage of the opportunities which their city offers for success, such as Beatriz. Some time ago, she decided to help with the household expenses to improve her family's quality of life. She sells cosmetics as a traveling saleswoman, traveling through the city's long streets to offer her products for sale. She makes deliveries and takes payments from her clients, who are mostly women. 

Beatriz has applied for a loan to buy some of the most popular products, using offers which her suppliers offer her. She will then be able to keep products in stock and satisfy the needs of her most demanding clients. She hopes to improve her earnings so that she can cover some of her household expenses and give her son a comfortable life and education.

Beatriz has joined up with two of her friends, Angélica and Decci, who are also small business owners.

Angélica, 33, is married and also sells cosmetics. She will invest in merchandise which will increase her income, so that she can give her two children a better quality of life.

Decci, 34, is married with three children. She will invest her part of the loan in the purchase of chickens and feed. She makes a living raising chickens to sell.

These three women joined up with one goal in common: to give up all pretexts about a lack of work and grow in their businesses to show everyone that it is possible to succeed by putting in effort and working hard.

loans.use: to buy products to keep her business stocked.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
Doña María Amparo tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de familia de 1 hijo el cual vive en su casa de habitación  junto a su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completado cursado hasta el 6 grado gracias al apoyo por parte de sus padres y al esfuerzo que ellos pusieron para que ella estudiara. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café hace más de 10 años actividad inculcada por sus padres ya que es una actividad practicada por su familia por muchos años y generaciones. Ella se traslada en compañía de su esposo y su hijo hasta el lugar donde están sus cultivos diariamente para dar asistencia técnica y evitar que sean dañados por la roya o por bichos. 

Ella solicita ayuda para comprar insumos y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos los cuales necesitan de limpieza, fertilización y abonarlos para cuidar la planta en su totalidad y el grano. 

Las metas es poder fertilizar y mantener sus cultivos como hasta hoy en día para obtener una cosecha de calidad y segura. Sus sueños como madre son los de seguir apoyando a su hijo para que el logre seguir estudiando y pueda graduarse a nivel universitario.
texts.en:
Doña María Amparo is 45 years old and the mother of one child. She lives with her husband and son in a house of their own. María Amparo completed her primary school education through the sixth grade, thanks in part to the support of her parents and also to the effort she put into her studies. She has been growing coffee for more than 10 years. María Amparo learned this business from her parents since her family has done this for many years and over several generations. She travels every day with her husband and son to the place where their crops are located. They must maintain the crops in order to prevent damage caused by diseases and pests.

María Amparo is requesting assistance so that she can buy supplies for maintaining her crops. She needs to weed, fertilize, and feed the coffee plants, which will provide total care for producing coffee beans. Her goal is to fertilize and maintain her crops in the same manner that she has always done to this point. This will help her achieve a secure and quality harvest.

Her dreams as a mother are to support her son as he continues his studies and to see him graduate to the university level.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 32-year-old dealer of electronics, mobile accessories and Mpesa in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is a married man who supports two people and has been in this business for the last four years, doing well with the help of his spouse.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET Ltd to finance his business. He will use the requested loan to purchase electronics and mobile accessories, and will use the anticipated profit to service his loan. He hopes to grow his business and have a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase electronics and mobile accessories.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 37 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages 9, 15 and 17. For 17 years now, Adelfa has grown rice for a living. She and her husband are also engaged in a fishing business. She is asking for a loan of 24,000 PHP to buy fish net, floaters, nylon, and fertilizer. 

She hopes to continue making improvements in her business so she can provide a better life for her family. Any income will be for her family's daily consumption and for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish net, floaters, nylon and fertilizer

loans.name: Muthui

texts.en:
Muthui, a 48-year-old man, is married and the father of five.  He hails from Mwingi, Kenya, and runs a business selling cereals and other grains to his customers in Mwingi. 

Muthui currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk and restock his store. 

With a loan through KADET LTD, Muthui will be able to purchase items such as beans, maize, ground nuts, green grams, millet, rice, and cow peas in bulk.

Muthui is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, having been introduced recently by one of KADET's staff.  The additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business. 

In the future, Muthui would like to invest, and support his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase items in bulk such as beans, maize, ground nuts, green grams, millet, rice, and cow peas

loans.name: Audrey

texts.en:
Audrey is 28 years old with two kids, ages 7 and 2. She runs a clothing business in Nairobi town. She has been in this business for two years, and her current monthly income is 18,000 Kenya shillings. Her husband is a graphic designer and also supports the family.  

This is her second loan with KADET LTD; she intends to purchase an additional stock of clothes for her shop. She will use the generated profits to open another clothing shop. 

Her hope is to have a line of boutique shops, make more income, and be able to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 32-year-old lady from Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports four people in her family. She is married to Imbuga, who is also a businessman. Together they have three children who are 13, 11 and 7 years old.

Beatrice has a retail shop which has been in operation for the last seven years. Due to limited sources of funding, she has decided to borrow from KADET LTD a second loan, which she will use to purchase shop items like sugar, maize flour, bar soap, and cooking oil. Beatrice intends to use the anticipated profit to diversify into another business.

Her dream is to have a stable business and to take good care of her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory for her shop (sugar, maize flour, bar soap, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: Prende

texts.en:
Prende has just finished paying off the previous loan that enabled her to build the animal stable. She is very grateful to all her lenders for their financial help. 

She is in need of help again to buy some feed for the animals.

Thanks for making it possible for our organization's borrowers to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals

loans.name: Danielka Lisseth

texts.es: Danielka  es una joven de 23 años, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad. Se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos por encargo, vende su producto en las comunidades rurales. Empezó a comprar ropa y cosméticos con dinero propio, lo cual  fue rentable. Solicita este crédito para comprar una vitrina donde exhibirá sus productos tales como: ropa y cosméticos. Tiene como ingreso su negocio y remesas que le manda su mama, su meta próxima es construir su vivienda,  ya que es el punto donde realiza sus ventas  logrando satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y comodidad a su familia, ya que son su apoyo. Tiene como expectativa llegar a ser una gran empresaria.  Este crédito será de mucho beneficio ya que le financiará dinero para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Danielka, 23, is from the city of Estelí. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 5. She has a business selling clothing and cosmetics by the order. She sells her products in rural communities. She started buying clothing and cosmetics with her own money, which was profitable. 

She has applied for a loan to buy a display case where she will exhibit her products, such as clothing and cosmetics. She has an income from her business as well as the money her mother sends her. Her main goal is to construct her home, because it is where she makes sales. She would like to satisfy her clients' needs and give comfort to her family, who are her support. She hopes to become a great professional. This loan will be of great help to her because she will be able to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Raul Fernando

texts.es:
Raul tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de ica, ciudad de clima calido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial los cultivos de algodón, uva, entre otros. Raul es un joven muy trabajador, sobre todo porque apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar, y para poder lograrlo trabaja como chofer de mototaxi,  Raul trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre tiene buena aptitud.

Raul esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar puertas para su mototaxi y realizar un mantenimiento al vehículo, de esta manera podrá tener un vehículo en mejores condiciones para trabajar, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su auto propio”.
texts.en:
Raúl, 26, lives in the city of Ica, a city with a hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture, especially growing cotton, grapes and others, flourishes here.  Raúl is a very hardworking young man above all because he helps his family cover household expenses and to do so works as a mototaxi driver.  Raúl works about 10 hours daily and can tend to almost 25 customers per day.  He believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very kind to customers and always has a good attitude.

Raúl is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy doors for his mototaxi and to service the vehicle.  In this way he will be able to have a vehicle in better working conditions which will make it possible for him to improve his income and continue striving to reach is greatest dream of owning a car.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and to buy doors for it.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives in the very nice city of Ijevan, with his retired parents, his wife, and their two daughters, who are still school-aged. For many years Artak has worked at the Ijevan Forestry as a forester, and simultaneously, he and his parents are engaged in farming and agriculture. Nevertheless, the income from both his forestry job and farming is not enough for his family's needs. That is why Artak periodically goes to the Russian Federation for work abroad, because he needs to somehow enlarge his family income.

In his farm, Artak cares for six cows, four heifers, five calves and twenty-five chickens. He also, together with his parents, cultivates their plot of land. They raise vegetables, and fruit and nut trees (e.g., apple, pear, plum, and hazelnut). They perfectly manage to sell products of their farm, including dairy products, eggs and fruits. With the income earned by farming, Artak has already bought some furniture for the house.

Now Artak wants to start a beekeeping business. Therefore, he asks for a loan, with which he will buy ten bee hives and some animal fodder. He hopes very much that this loan will surely enlarge his family income, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ten bee hives for a new beekeeping business, and some animal fodder for the cows

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 40 years old and from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married to a fisherman, and they have four children between the ages of 4 and 13. 

For a year now, Alma has been working hard selling fresh fish in her neighborhood to provide for the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish to sell. Her profit provides food for her family, as well as school fees for her children.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Alvina

texts.en:
Alvina is 35 years old and from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married, and her husband works as a fisherman. They also do rice farming for an income. Together, they work hard so they can provide for their seven children, ages 5 to 16. 

She is asking for a loan to buy bamboo, screen, and nylon for their fishing. 

In the future, she hopes to expand their business and venture unto other business options so she can better provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, screen, and nylon

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 70 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Hace 8 años que se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras. Antes vivía en otro departamento del país junto a su compañero de vida,  se dedicaba a la elaboración de ladrillo de barro, porque no tenía otra actividad que le generara  ingresos. Aprendió  este oficio de cría de aves porque su hermano realizaba esta actividad y ella colaboraba en el mantenimiento de los pollos.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar un saldo pendiente en fundación campo, también va a comprar 6 quintales de concentrado para sus pollas ponedoras que algunas ya iniciaron la etapa de postura y necesitan estar bien alimentadas para aumentar su producción.
Con la inversión, cubrirá la deuda y tendrá capital para seguir trabajando y generar ingresos pues sus aves ponedoras ya le están produciendo y no tiene otra opción para trabajar más que el crédito y poder tener otras oportunidades que siempre se propone lograr.
Ella manifiesta que quiere seguir trabajando con la fundación, aumentar su producción de huevos y carne, ampliar poco a poco sus galeras para darles un mejor confort a sus aves.
texts.en:
Antonia is 70 years old, in a relationship, and has two children. She has been raising and selling fattened chickens and egg-laying hens for eight years. Antonio and her partner previously lived in another part of the country. He earns his living by making bricks out of clay, but they needed an additional income-generating business. Antonia learned the poultry trade from her brother since he was in the same line of work. She helped him with taking care of the chickens.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to pay off an outstanding debt with the institution. She will also buy six quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of concentrated feed for her egg-laying hens. Some of the hens are already in the production stage, so they need to be well fed so that they can increase production.

With this investment, Antonia will be able to pay off a debt and have capital to continue her work. As a result, she will be able to generate income from the egg-laying hens that are in production. Antonia has no other choice but to work more. The loans have given her the opportunity to accomplish other goals that she always wanted to achieve. She says that she wants to continue working with Fundación Campo so that she can increase her production of eggs and meat. Antonia also wants to make gradual expansions to her chicken coops so that the birds will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy concentrated poultry feed and to pay off an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Lorenza Isabel

texts.es: Lorenza tiene cincuenta y nueve (59) años de edad, vive en el municipio de Soledad, tierra de la butifarra, popular alimento típico de esta población, que se come acompañado con bollo de yuca, y limón; en las fiestas se usa mucho como picada. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la comercialización de electrodomésticos pequeños, como licuadoras, tostadoras, picatodos, y artículos de lencerías para el hogar como cubrelechos, colchas, forros, tapetes varios. Estos productos los vende a crédito a vecinos del sector que se los solicitan. Compra de contado a mayoristas y por catalogos. Desde hace quince (15) años inició el negocio, el cual lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes desde hace mucho tiempo vienen ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, y le transfirieron toda su experiencia. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de electrodomésticos, cubrelechos, y en la adecuación de un local que va abrir, para tener un punto de exhibición de su mercancía. Con esta inversión espera dar a conocer y posicionar su negocio con el punto de venta, asi, como mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 59 years old and lives in the municipality of Soledad, home of the butifarra [sausage], a popular food from the area which is eaten with a yucca  roll and lemon. During the fiestas it is often eaten as an appetiser. 

Lorenza has a business selling small electrical appliances such as liquidizers, toasters and food choppers as well as household linens such as various bedspreads, quilts, covers and tablecloths. She sells these products on credit to local neighbours who ask for them. She buys in cash at wholesalers and through catalogues. She started the business 15 years ago and learnt it from her parents who had been in this line of business for a long time and passed their experience on to her. 

This is her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy electrical appliances and bedspreads and to convert premises which she is going to open so she can have somewhere to display her goods. Using this loan she hopes to raise the profile of the business by having a point of sale, and so improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances and bedspreads and to convert premises which she is going to open so she can have somewhere to display her goods.

loans.name: Karina Narciza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 21, 5 y 3 años, uno de ellos estudia en escuela todos sus hijos viven en su casa. El marido es artesano. 

Doña Karina con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, edredones, toallas, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos cuando necesitan algo, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar toallas, edredones y sabanas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “La Victoria” (Victory) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Manta’s La Victoria neighborhood.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular year-round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Karina, 37, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 21, 5 and 3 years old.  One of them attends school and all her children live at home.  Her husband’s a craftsman.

In order to earn her own income to help her husband cover household expenses, Karina is a merchant.  She sells sheets, comforters and sheets, among other things.  Her way of selling is door-to-door and also sells from home; her best known customers come by there when they need anything.  She sells on credit and collects every fifteen days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise as needed.  She’s been in this business five years and does very well.

She will use this loan to buy towels, comforters and sheets.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because she finances her business with the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy towels, comforters and sheets.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es de la ciudad de Pilar, proviene de una familia numerosa y trabajadora, está en el quinto año de la carrera de derecho, y se está esforzando al máximo por ser una estudiante destacada y ser el día de mañana una buena profesional.
Ella quiere poder ayudar a su familia, luchar y trabajar por un futuro mejor. También quiere ser de ayuda para su comunidad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Nora is from the city of Pilar and comes from a large hardworking family. She is in her fifth year of studies toward earning a law degree. Nora does her absolute best to be a dedicated student so that one day she will become a successful professional.

She wants to help her family, so Nora works and strives toward a better future. In addition, she wants to help her community. Nora is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees. This will be of great help because she can continue studying as normal. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of much help.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey lived in Azerbaijan for many years. Finally he has come back to his sweet motherland. He got married and today has a large and traditional lovely Armenian family. Sergey has three children: two sons who are married and live with their families with Sergey, and a daughter who is married and lives separately with her family. 

Sergey’s whole family is employed, all working at the local schools as teachers. For many years, Sergey worked as a teacher, then as a school administrator. Now he is director of the village school. The family also works together in farming and agriculture, which gives them great pleasure. They have a rich and very nice farm. They have 45 bee hives, five bulls, one heifer, and more than 30 chickens. They also cultivate a huge plot of land, growing potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, apples, peaches, pears, plums and nuts. Sergey is a very clever farmer and manages to earn money by selling all kinds of farm products that they have grown. Their largest source of income is from the sale of meat, honey and nuts. 

Sergey has asked for a loan of 2,800 USD in order to buy several bulls, bee hives, and also animal fodder. It will be Sergey’s first deal with Kiva lenders, but Sergey has cooperated with Kiva field partner Nor Horizon several times and all the loans helped him very much. He greatly relies on Kiva lenders’ kindness and support and hopes for a future deal.

loans.use: To buy several bulls, bee hives and animal fodder

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 73 years old and lives in the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has eight adult children. For 23 years now, she has been engaged in selling basic household commodities, like snacks, canned goods, soft drinks, toiletries, coffee and seasonings. Her income provides food and payment for household bills. She is thankful that, in spite of her age, she can still do something to make both ends meet.

She is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional inventory, like canned goods, noodles, rice and seasonings. In the future, she hopes to sell and introduce more items to her customers, for a better income.

loans.use: to buy inventory to sell, including canned goods, noodles, rice and seasonings

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 23 years old and is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two children ages two and three. 

Anecita helps her husband in their fishing business. They work hard to catch fish and sell their catch in the community to earn a living. She is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy nylon, floaters and fish net.

She hopes that with a loan she can sustain her business and even make improvements. Her income provides food for her family. 

In the future, she hopes to send her children to school and expand her business for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy nylon, floaters and fish net

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet lives in Malindi Kenya.  She is married and blessed with three children. For more than five years she has been selling clothes for men and women, boys and girls, in the local market. She learned about Milango through friends when she needed credit to buy clothes for her business. This business is the sole income source for her and she has devoted much of her time to it. She seeks a loan to buy plastic materials and school uniforms for her business. Business challenges she faces include price changes and competition form other dealers.

loans.use: to buy plastic materials and school uniforms

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en: Apolinario is a 51-year-old fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a widower with six children, ages 10 to 24. He is the sole provider for his family. Apolinario has operated a fishing business for 40 years now, starting when he was just a boy. He is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net. His income supports his children's education. He dreams of expanding his business to make it more profitable. In the future, he hopes to buy a new and bigger boat for better profits.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude lives in Chardonnières where he works as a building technician and professor. His wife also work as secretary. They married and have two 2 children in school. He is interesting in becoming a retailer to promote EarthSpark products to help farmers so they do not continue to cut down trees, consume kerosene for lighting, and have more savings. He has bought clean energy products in the past but now wishes to join the EarthSpark team as a clean energy entrepreneur.  

He is looking for a loan to help him purchase EarthSpark products to sell in his locality. He is looking to purchase solar light bulbs, solar desk lamps and efficient stoves. With a Kiva loan, Claude will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills to launch his business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a clean energy retail business.

loans.name: Marjorie Ismenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Maryorie, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  14 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es contador, ella hace varios años aprendió belleza en un centro artesanal en la ciudad.

Doña Maryorie para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de su hijo desde hace ya 10 años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza, en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Ella también allí mismo se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ropa, tintes, permanentes y otros cosméticos para su trabajo. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es tener un SPA.
texts.en:
The “La Victoria” (Victory) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Manta’s La Victoria neighborhood.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular year-round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Marjorie, 33, lives here.  She’s married and has a 14-year-old son attending secondary school.  Her husband’s an accountant.  She learned beauty several years ago in a crafts center in the city.

To earn income of her own to help her husband cover household expenses and her son’s schooling costs, Marjorie opened a beauty salon at home ten years ago where she does various jobs like hair coloring, haircuts, applying nail polish, among others.  She also sells clothes via catalog.  She works every day from 8am until 8pm and sometimes even later if her customers require her services.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, dyes, permanents and other cosmetics for her work.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the help and the benefits she gets from the bank.  Her dream is to own a spa.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dyes, permanents and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain es estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que su meta principal es poder terminar sus estudios y ayudar económicamente a sus padres, ya que ellos son quienes lo han apoyado siempre.
Estudia para poder trabajar y ser un gran profesional que ayude a las demás personas que necesiten de sus conocimientos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad y también sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Efrain is a student who is earning a degree in Business Administration. He says that his main goal is to finish his studies so that he can help his parents financially since they have always supported him.

Efrain is pursuing his studies so that he can work and become a successful professional. This will enable him to help other people who are in need of his knowledge. Efrain is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university classes and also the fees.

loans.use: to pay for his university classes and fees.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Kuña Aty está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité, en donde todas están con muchas ganas de crecer, mejorar sus vidas y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Margarita quien está en un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, irá mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una marca muy conocida, también se dedica a la venta de plásticos, y por medio de su trabajo y su lucha está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia para darles todo lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Margarita con este crédito comprara nuevos insumos para su venta de productos de belleza, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y así ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group is in its first cycle of the committee program, where they all have are very eager to grow, improve their lives, and therefore be able to help their families. They are participating in the survey for the elimination of poverty, where 10 of them find themselves below the poverty line.

One of the members is Margarita, who is in the first level of poverty, that is, with a very low income, but she is conscious that through effort, continuous work, and the application of the vital behavior of a successful woman, she will improve her poverty situation. She makes a living selling beauty products from a very well-known brand. She also sells plastics, and through the means of her work and her struggle, she is coming out ahead and helping her family by giving them everything they need.

With this loan, Margarita will buy new supplies for her beauty products business, which will help her to set her business plan. This will help her to improve her income and therefore continue improving her poverty situation.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las divinas están en su ciclo uno del programa de comités, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, están con muchas expectativas de ir mejorando y creciendo. Son 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y entusiastas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cynthia, tesorera del grupo, ella motiva a sus demás compañeras a trabajar en forma disciplinada para el logro de los objetivos, ya que con ellos podrán mejorar sus ingresos y niveles de vida. Ella tiene como actividad las ventas ya que tiene una despensa, en la que día a día y desde muy tempranas horas trabaja para poder tener los medios y ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, frutas, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The "Las Divinas" group is requesting its first loan with the communal bank. They are learning to work together. They have high expectations of improving and growing. The group is made up of 16 hard-working and enthusiastic women.

Cynthia is one of the members. She is the treasurer of the group. She motivates the other members to work in a disciplined manner in order to achieve their goals, since they can work together to improve their income and quality of life. She makes a living in sales with her small grocery store in which she works every day, beginning very early in the morning, in order to have the means to help her family.

She requests this loan to buy products for her grocery store, like drinks, food, fruit, vegetables, and other supplies so that she can continue to offer the things that her customers need.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, fruit, vegetables, and other supplies to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is married and has three children. Her husband is seeking employment in a neighboring country.  As the unemployment rate in this region is very high, he had to leave his country to financially support his family. Armine has been involved in agriculture for many years, breeding cattle and cultivating barley and potatoes. 

Armine works hard to run their farm and sustain her children's living. Her son helps her very much with running the farm and gathering harvest. He sells the harvest locally and gathers income, which is vital for their family. 

Armine is requesting a loan, which she will use to improve her farming business. She needs to purchase fuel for covering cultivation costs, which is very important for having a good harvest next season. Armine hopes to have a big and profitable farm and ensure a better life for their children so her husband will be able to come back home and stay with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for covering cultivation costs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of seven children, and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a food stall, which she has owned and operated for five years.  She works from home, six days out of every week. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of green fingerling bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and tomatoes. She is aspiring to own a bigger food stall, and to start going to villages to buy foodstuffs for her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of green fingerling bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is a farmer and lives with his wife who helps him with the farming activities. They live in the small village of Byurakn, in Shirak region. The couple breeds cattle and cultivates haricots and potatoes. As a result of their hard and tireless work, the family is now able to earn income to sustain their standard of living. 
As a hard-working farmer who dreams of developing his farm, Andranik has applied for this loan to purchase a drill for cultivation work. This will help him  with his harvest and will significantly improve his income.
Andranik dreams of having a big farm and to be able to improve his and his wife's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a drill for cultivation work

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah  is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her mother and a cousin. She has run a business selling used clothes for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1400000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market five days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis only and to educate her children up to the university. Her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Beinvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 55 years old from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 15 to 21. To support them, she sells eggs, sausage and water in her neighborhood for an income. She has been in business for two years now. She is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more eggs and chorizo and to pay for her water supply. She hopes that with the additional inventory, she can sell more and increase her profitability. 

In the future, she hopes to be successful in sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and chorizo and pay for her water supply

loans.name: María Gricelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y el menor tiene 17 años y  estudian en universidad. El marido es comerciante. 

Doña María utiliza el crédito tanto para ella como para su esposo ya que ambos se dedican a sus negocios pero por separado, ella es la encargada del bar de una escuela de la localidad y él tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual vende ceviches, encebollados, pescado y hornado con chifles platos muy apetecidos por las personas de la localidad, ella vende bocadillos preparados por ella misma que son saludables y nutritivos así como también jugos de frutas muy ricos, ya que ella los hace deliciosos para el gusto de los más pequeños, ella tiene este negocio por más de 7 años y su marido mucho mas, así ellos salen delante de una manera honesta y honrada.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar pescado,mariscos, carne de cerdo, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de  4 años y le gusta porque con los créditos han mejorado sus negocios. 

Su sueño es que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
The “La Victoria” (Victory) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Manta’s La Victoria neighborhood.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular year-round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

María, 50, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children; one is an adult and the other is 17-years-old and both attend university.  Her husband’s a merchant.

María will use the loan for herself and for her husband since both of them run separate businesses.  She’s in charge of a snack bar at a local school and he has a small dining room at home where he sells seafood cocktails, seafood stew, fish and roasted pork with fried banana chips which are very popular local dishes.  She sells tasty, nutritious snacks she makes herself as well as very delicious fruit juices that she makes to please the little ones.  She’s been in this business for more than 7 years and her husband has been at it much longer.  This is how they get ahead in an honest, honorable way. 

The loan will be used to buy fish, seafood, pork, fruit and other food items needed to prepare the dishes.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than four years and likes it because the loans have improved their businesses.  Her dream is that her son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy fish, seafood, pork, fruit and other food items.

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford is 28 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has operated a sari-sari store (variety store) for 10 years now. This is his very means of earning a living. He sells canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and noodles. He is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy seasonings, noodles, canned goods and toiletries.

In the future, he hopes to be able to continue expanding his business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, noodles, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 44 years old, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 11-22. She has been in the business of raising hogs and farming rice for 23 years now. 

Cristina is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to further sustain her main livelihood. She will use her loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

She dreams of seeing a productive rice field to meet the needs of her family. In the future, she would like to see her children successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for her rice field.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a 35-year-old woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with an eight-year-old daughter. Desideria has been engaged in fishing and rice farming for eight years now. She is asking for a loan to buy lead weights, fish net, nylon and fertilizer. 

She hopes to give her child a better future through education. And her income will be for school fees and family daily food consumption.

loans.use: to buy lead weights, fish net, nylon and fertilizer

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Aminata, from Moriba town Bo. She is married, with four children between the ages of 10 and 27 years.
